Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location with Spectacular view!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSoutherner
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week this winter and very much enjoyed the hotel, staff and amenities. I had a south facing view of the Chicago River and Willis Tower, which was incredible. The room was nice and very comfortable, especially the bed and linens. The hotel staff, including front desk, bell staff, concierge, housekeeping and room service, were all very professional, friendly and efficient. The only drawbacks were the television reception, which was very slow and lots of static. This did not really bother me as i only turned on the tv one of the 7 days; however, others did complain about this. The restaurant/room service is pricey, but to be expected for downtown location. This hotel is conveniently located to great restaurants, shopping and sites. You can easily walk or take a quick cab ride to any place you want to go. All in all a great visit and i'll be back on the next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service all around”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveler025
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation at this hotel, and when I punched in the address in my GPS it did not come up. I called the hotel and spoke to Todd. He was very helpful, asked me to apply another address and let me know to make sure and turn immediately after the river. When I arrived, and saw the quick turn, I was so glad that he told me this. I would not have been excited to reroute another 2 blocks in heavy Chicago traffic. When I pulled up the bellman, Johnny, could not have been more helpful. He was so polite and friendly and told me everything about the hotel's amenities. He suggested the hotel bar for dining as they have a great view of the city on the 15th floor. I did go to the bar area and the food was very good and the view spectacular. When I checked in Valerie was also very helpful. Everything was great. I would definately reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: SaminBayat
Reviews.Content: Pros - Free internet with our reservation - Cheaper parking compared to other hotels in the Near North area. ($30/night with in and out privileges in March 2012) - A good bar and restaurant with a great view of the river - Clean spacious rooms Cons - No elevator from parking to the hotel - Not all room have the wonderful view!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: Firefanne
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel! I had friends that stayed here over the weekend, and it was perfect! (I didn't stay here, but I did visit them, saw their room, wandered around the hotel, and used the concierge service with them). I think the hotel is in a great location. It's easy to get anywhere downtown, in river north, or off the brown line. This place has amazing views! The views from the rooms are stunning, the views from the bar are incredible, the views from random areas in the lobby are outstanding. Really, the view is that great. The room was nice. I think what makes this place amazing is the staff. I got a flat on my bike on the way to visiting them. Since there are no gas stations particularly close, I thought I would see if the hotel's garage had an air compressor/some type of pump. We asked the concierge. The concierge called the engineer, but didn't get a response, so he called the nearby Ace Hardware and quoted me 2 pumps. We didn't get to Ace until they had closed. So when we returned from dinner we asked the concierge to ask the engineer again. He called the engineer down to meet with us. The engineer was able to blow up the tire. The staff were so friendly and so helpful! My friends had a great time, and plan to stay here again anytime they need a hotel in the city in the future! Oh, parking is $40 per night, while that's a lot, it's not crazy for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Starts well but goes downhill”
Reviews.Author: MIfamilyguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an interesting location: it occupies the top nine floors of a 23-floor office block and looks south over the Chicago river. Entrance is through the very grand foyer, then into an elevator to the fifteenth floor hotel lobby. This too is very stylish, but from there it's downhill. The room was just Holiday Inn average and looked like a refurb wouldn't have hurt. It's hard to be sure though because the lighting was pretty bad. The view was probably quite dramatic, but it was hard to tell because the window seemed not to have been washed since 2003. Two other grumbles are that the walls are pretty thin, so keep your voice down, and the heater was very loud. On the plus side, the bathroom was very good - clean and modern with a good shower and a tub that drained well. Another definite plus is the pool - big enough to swim laps and like the bathroom, spotless. And the location is good, right next to the Merchandise Mart and about a seven minutes walk along the river to Michigan Avenue. Self-park is available just in front of the hotel, and at $39 with unlimited in-out it's actually a pretty good deal for downtown Chicago. One weird thing that I feel compelled to mention: some time after midnight my wife and I were woken by the room moving. Yes, seriously, the floor and our bed seemed to be bouncing up and down, which was a little alarming. I thought about calling the front desk but I wasn't sure what to say ... "excuse me but my bed is bouncing"? Anyway, after a while it seemed to stop and we were able to get back to sleep, but very odd all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: Hootlc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Chicago - Plaza Mart February 18 - 20. This hotel is in the perfect location and it has amazing views. Per other trip advisor posts I requested a higher floor and a room with a view. For $109.00 per night (including parking) we had a room overlooking downtown Chicago from where the canals all meet. It wasn't a lake view but it was still amazing! The hotel starts on the 15th floor of the Chicago Sun Times building. It is connected to the Merchandise Mart by a skywalk. The merchandise mart has fast food restaurants such as McDonalds, Dunkin Donuts and just window shopping was fun. You catch the brown line train right from the Merchandise Mart. Our room was clean, beds comfortable. Don't ask the doorman about anything it seems as though they are just looking to make a kick back or something. Traveling by train is very easy (purchase a transit pass... good for bus and train). FYI if you plan to go to Sheds... grrr..... make sure you have purchased tickets and have them in hand or plan on standing in line FOREVER!!! Even will call has a long line!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a view”
Reviews.Author: emery2e
Reviews.Content: This is sleeper for a downtown hotel. Located on the Chicago river with excelent views. Nicw bar area with views and separate area for breakfast. Easy to get to Michigan and State street shopping. Rooms are clean and staff very helpful. As a local I stay here every time

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: eaglezwingz1
Reviews.Content: Excellent facility, ideal location, the friendliest staff I've ever encountered in a Holiday Inn. Perfect from arrival to departure (across a 3 day stay). We arrived early and they welcomed and accommodated us early! Lovely pool, great fitness centre, service at every turn. Clean facility all the way through, comfortable beds. The doorman and concierge were fabulous! Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: serenamcn
Reviews.Content: Fabulous Hotel for the money. Beautiful views of the Chicago River. Friendly staff and excellent doorman who helped with luggage and hailing a cab. On site parking. Rooms were updated, clean, comfortable and quiet. Nice bed linens and choices of pillows. A great value!

Reviews.Title: “Ist time visit”
Reviews.Author: vancouverite1_10
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The view was stunning, the service friendly, my room was what you'd expect for this grade, and the restaurant dinners were outstanding thanks to a 5 star chef, who didn't want to give me his name. On the down side, you cannot open windows --I can see why -- it's easy to fall out of them, the AC is loud, as it is in most hotels, and the blankets are synthetic. I wish hotels would supply cotton or wool blankets. Nevertheless I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Little to no Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: GSChip
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for triple occupancy and upon check-in they wanted to put us in a room with just a King bed. After MUCH talking, we were able to get a room with a King and a pull out sofa...which worked ok. The first night there we ate in their restaurant. We'd been told that the hotel was sold out, so it was shocking that there were only 2 servers working the entire dining room. The food was decent, but the entire dining experience took us no less than 2.5 hours...really felt bad for the server, he was good and very appologetic for our wait. The best part of this hotel is its location next to the Merchandise Mart...our reason for being in town, the Gift Show.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional view and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: justmaryp
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed at this hotel before and to be honest I didn't realize that it would be so convenient a location when I booked it. It's an unusual set up where you enter the building and have to take an elevator up to the hotel lobby on the 5th floor. The hotel is housed on the 15-19th floors of the hotel. When we checked in they mentioned "corner view" room but I didn't know what they meant.. well.. if you stay here, get a corner view room! Two of the room's walls were almost completely glass. One view was of the river and the other towards the city. At night it was gorgeous! Our first night there we didn't know where to eat and the woman at the desk suggested Lou Malnati's .. for it's traditional Chicago Style pizza. The restaurant was a quick walk to blocks over. The next day we were able to walk to Michigan Ave, the Navy Pier and back to the hotel. That night it was a $7 cab ride over to the Hyatt Regency for the event we were in town to attend. I would definitely stay at this hotel again the next time I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: Tamhicks10
Reviews.Content: We spent a little extra to get a room with a corner view. It was beautiful at night to lay in bed and see the lights. The room was decorated okay and was nice. It will probably need a makeover before to terrible long. The room was a great size as well. The heater in the room would kick on and it was SUPER loud. I mean, wake me up load. This was a bummer. There is no valet parking wither. So we parked below and walked up the icy stairs outside. The parking lot wasn't plowed very well either. Another plus was how close the hotel was to the L. You don't even have to go outside to get there. The waiter at the City Scape bar didn't seem to be enjoying his job either. But he wasn't really rude, just not personable. A beer there was $7. It did have a great view. Great little restaurants and bars within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ogursoy
Reviews.Content: I have booked my trip online and since I have been traveling without a car, I needed to stay in downtown. The location of the hotel was excellent and we had a room with a river view which was fantastic. This hotel also connects to the mall so the entrance is little bit tricky. There is an Au Bon Pain next to the hotel which I have visited couple times for breakfast. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: dickn
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable rates for downtown Chicago. Parking is a little out of the way. Shopping and restaurants in walking distance. Great lobby bar with fantastic view.

Reviews.Title: “Family reunion”
Reviews.Author: lbfavored1
Reviews.Content: While attending our family reunion which was in Gary Indiana, we decided to stay in Chicago at the Holiday Inn so we would be able to enjoy all the "happenings" downtown. The hotel offered a breakfast daily and the Mart Plaza was like be in the center of everything! We could shop in stores in the plaza, visit different resturants and then go to lower level to catch the bus. It could not get any better. The hotel lobby was nice with a bar and great view. The staff was friendly and very accommodating, we did not like the fact that parking was $30.00 per day. Room was clean but had no fridge and other amenities we thought would be standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views of the River”
Reviews.Author: RyanC78
Reviews.Content: Good central location. Not your average Holiday Inn, this property was renovated a few years back. Great openness in the lobby with fantastic lobby bar with 180 degree views of the skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Views, easy parking and great people”
Reviews.Author: SilverfoxStLouis
Reviews.Content: This little gem sits right next to or perhaps on top of the Merchandise Mart at the fork of the North and South branch of the Chicago River.Rooms are clean and in great shape. The 'L' train stops here so you are connected everywhere. Linger over really good nosh in the lobby bar while enjoying some great views of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Better that I had hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: Manoutdoors
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip because it was the cheapest one closest to where I needed to be. The staff was fantastic and I couldn't have been happier with the room. Everything was clean and comfortable. The WiFi is free and fast. I certainly got more than I expected. I avoid Chicago like the plague, but if I ever had to travel there again I would gladly stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: JustaGuyOakPark_IL
Reviews.Content: It had been years since I'd been in this hotel, and the last trip wasn't pleasant. But, when my son and I had to escape from his sister's 10th birthday party sleepover, it was one of the few choices for a Chicago hotel with a pool. We were surprised by how nice the hotel was, it's convenient location, and the quality of the amenities. It seemed to be recently refurbished, so it was modern and comfortable. Truly, a great value in the city. Room service was a bit slow, but the food was quite good. All in all, a really nice trip. I was shocked that a Holiday Inn could be so nice (and that this one had been so nicely upgraded).

Reviews.Title: “Very suprised.”
Reviews.Author: itisdale
Reviews.Content: Was able to book a 2-queen room for $85 / night...and was expecting an $85 / night experience. For being so close to downtown, we thought there was great value for the property. We did try to book in another time and was offered the same room type for almost $200. Then it would be a rip off. If you are thinking of a family trip to Chicago - I would like to suggest purchasing a Go Chicago Card. We saw and experienced so much. Walked to Navy Pier every morning and rented bikes (you get a half day with your card - then paid an extra $4 to upgrade the rental to full day). We biked EVERYWHERE - from Wrigley Field, Lincoln Park Zoo, John Hancock Tower, Peggy Notebart Museum, etc... in the north to the Willis Tower, the 'bean', The Museum of Science and Industry, etc... in the South. Not to mention all the activities at the Pier. Chicago was such a great summer city to visit - we plan on returning again, SOON!

Reviews.Title: “Nice at the price BUT!”
Reviews.Author: number10Toledo_ohio
Reviews.Content: I got a king room for $90 a nite..not bad at all for around the Holidays in Chicago. The place needs some cosmetic touching up but otherwise was very clean and the beds were super comfy. The lobby bar was awesome...great city view. The Bown line "L" comes thru the Merchandise Mart and there is a walkway connecting the two buildings. Draw backs - The Hotel starts in the 15th floor of the SUN Times building so u have to go up 15 to the Lobby, then take another elevator to your room floor. Not bad for the young at heart but it could be a bit tedious for seniors. Another draw back was the "self parking" in their lot. Secure and close BUT at $39 bucks a nite, I'd look round the corner for cheaper public lots. Over all, it was worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Views.”
Reviews.Author: cdurbin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riverview two nights before Christmas. Nice room with great views. Front desk staff was just OK. The bar staff was not overly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View And Service”
Reviews.Author: ypwalter
Reviews.Content: Hotel is from 15F to 26F. I think the night view in this hotel is wonderful around almost all the rooms. It's normal holiday inn, and always good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: napergrl
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Holiday Inn Mart Plaza are on the average side as far as decorating and maybe showing a little wear and tear but they are clean and well appointed. The walls are thin-we could hear the alarm going off in the room next to us. The view, however, of the Chicago River and city is spectacular. They have a very nice bar that takes advantage of the view. The staff is friendly. We ordered room service for breakfast and it was pretty pricey for very average food-what did I expect? We were there for a party held in one of their banquet rooms which also has the entire wall of floor to ceiling windows with a great view of the city lights. Great location and is connected to the Mart. We walked to State Street and to Water Tower areas pretty easily-but we like to walk. Compared to other Chicago hotels, it is usually pretty reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: BED BUGS!!! DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL. My fiance and I just tried to check into this hotel this past Saturday. My fiance is a pest control technician, so we literally check EVERYWHERE we stay now for bed bugs. By check, I mean strip down the bed, lift the mattress, lift the box spring, pillows, bed frame...EVERYTHING. Thank god we lifted the box spring this time! My fiance knew something was up because the box spring had a bed bug encasement sheet on it. Once we lifted the box spring and took a flash light to the bottom, you literally could see about 10 bed bugs and the fecal matter!! We immediately called down to the front desk and explained what we found. They tried to give us a room on the same floor and were very casual about the whole situation. EXTREMELY DISSAPPOINTED! We requested our money back and left the hotel immediately. You seriously cannot take any changes with these things. Once you bring them home, it is very hard to get rid of. I know sometimes hotels like to respond to these type of posts and explain that it actually was not bed bugs and that it was ants, or some other creature. I TOOK A PICTURE WITH MY PHONE, so don't even try to deny this!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for meetings”
Reviews.Author: mojoWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a 2-day meeting and was very pleased with everything. My room was spacious, comfortable and very well set up for a business traveler, even if the decor was a bit tired, and the views were gorgeous. The reliable free wi-fi turned out to be a real life saver when a minor crisis arose. The staff was incredibly helpful, worthy of a 5-star hotel. The meeting I attended used two large meeting rooms, one with more great views, that were great meeting spaces. The food served was fresh and terrific. Truly one of the most pleasant meeting experiences ever, and I expect to check this property next time I go to Chicago for personal business.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel decent location”
Reviews.Author: mtaiwai
Reviews.Content: We (group of 4) found this place quite last minute (night before Thanksgiving) on hrs.de and decided to try it out. The location is quite near the financial district. Location wise it is walking distance to Willis tower. But with the CTA day pass, no place is too far in Chicago. We parked our car in the hotel car park ($36 per day)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel within walking distance of shopping and good food”
Reviews.Author: Bowling_Guru
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Mart Plaza is a great hotel sitting ontop of the Chicago Sun Times building. Rooms are nice, pool is nice, food is decent, and the hotel is in a great location for views of the Chicago River. The best part is you dont even have to leave the hotel to get food or hop on a train.

Reviews.Title: “Most beatiful views from 22nd floor”
Reviews.Author: jai_dxb
Reviews.Content: It was easily accessible from public transit and right on the river. I flew into Midway and it took me about 30 minutes on a Friday night. For those that are unclear, this hotel is on top of the Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel-Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tdb_11
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with booking in advance I was able to secure a very reasonable rate. The room was large for a city hotel with a rather large bathroom with plenty of closet space. The views from the room were fantastic. The restaurant was great with good food at a reasonable rate with good service. I will be looking forward to my return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning 21st floor views but ... wifi terrible”
Reviews.Author: momNpop
Reviews.Content: We found a good online rate for both rooms for family Thanksgiving in West Loop. The window walls of the corner executive king offered fabulous cityscape views, the bed was comfortable (no bedbuds) & small fridge necessary. Downstairs, the pool and exercise room were tops, and we found the bar and reasonable $ breakfast buffets good places to relax and nosh. When a knee injury meant walking became very painful, Philip, on duty in the lobby, searched the storage room & found help. He also located a walker, but the cane w/ arm brace was enough to get me outside to enjoy Zoo Lights opening night. So why not 5 star? Hot water & a good wifi signal were both too hard to achieve. For an advertised green hotel to have patrons wasting water before it's warm enough to shower is a problem that needs fixing. And my hubbie, who always travels w/ laptop & iphone, was frustrated by the weak (Verizon) signal in our room. Was it better in the biz center? Don't know because HI-MP has the quirk of free in-room wifi on your devices but $$ wifi in the biz centerâ€”and who needs any additional cost? Location was great for visiting the newlyweds but wifi & water may have us chancing the Crowne Plaza again (which had bedbugs summer 2010) Detour for foodies: After Zoo Lights we headed to The Counter for best burgers so far in Chicago. It's fun to decide how to build'em in this well-lit, casual family spot. With all the 50-cent additions to choose from, believe me, you don't need a 3/4 pounder. And the pretzel burger is great way to hold it all together. Late night sorbet & wine in the HI bar went well w/ my painkillers, allowing sleep before (another) game day w/ the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a reasonable price....sometimes”
Reviews.Author: vintage1990
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Priceline for the weekend of 10/21/2011-10/24/2011 (3 nights) for ~$120/night after taxes. It was easily accessible from public transit and right on the river. I flew into Midway and it took me about 30 minutes on a Friday night. For those that are unclear, this hotel is on top of the Chicago Sun-Times building. From the outside, it doesn't appear very special but after you take the elevator to the hotel lobby, it is nice without being overly ostentatious. We were originally booked for a bed with a single king bed but instead asked for one with two double beds. Initially, we were told this was unavailable but a manager overheard our request and he freed one up for us. The room was reasonable size with a spacious bathroom. The bathroom did not have a vent fan which was annoying after showering but nothing to make me not stay here again. I left a note for the cleaning crew to leave some extra shampoo and they did so. Beds were not great but not terrible. Four Pillows come with each bed (two firm, two plush). Our room was an inner room which meant the only view we had was of the pool (which closes at 11pm. It would've been nice to have a view of the river or the city but because we had already placed one special request we decided not to go to the well too many times. The hotel bar had fantastic views. Drinks at the bar were a bit expensive. The free Wifi was convenient and never dropped out once. A/C units were noisy. For the price I paid ($120/night) I would recommend it but I would have difficulty paying the asking price of $200+/night for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Renae G
Reviews.Content: We are from Chicago and we used this hotel for our wedding room block. The sales staff were extremely helpful. We got a good room rate for all our block. The views from the hotel lobby, bar, and guest rooms are outstanding. The guest rooms were comfortable and clean. There is a ton within walking distance which was really great for our out of town guests. It is a perfect location to be near everything, but not so close where you get all the noise and commotion. Great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Samthe3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off the beaten path but certainly within walking distance to things and right on the Brown line. We have a corner room #2045 and it has a Great view of downtown and fairly large. The bed and furniture are in serious need of an upgrade and the pillows are........ Just bad! Service has been ok and for the price you can't beat it. We also have a mini fridge in our room which is nice to keep water cold. There is a convenient store on the 1st floor as well as a Starbucks and CVS less then a block away. We have stayed here before and as I stated you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Needs Attitude Adjustment”
Reviews.Author: James62364
Reviews.Content: WOW! I'm here four nights, and have never been treated so rudely by staff numbers! Whether you are in the bar, one bartender gave me and charged me for the wrong ticket, one bartender (waiter) was very rude to myself and others in my party. He acted as if he didn't want to wait on anyone.... Then I called the front deck this morning to ask a question about my bill... And the person I spoke was VERY rude! I would not recommend this hotel for business or pleasure unless you really don't interact with the hotel personnel.....

Reviews.Title: “very clean hotel with close safe parking”
Reviews.Author: agreatday050510
Reviews.Content: Let us check in early. room did not have the view others were talking about but I did not ask for a room with a view so it was ok. Did not spend that much time in room anyway. There was a nice bar and restaurant in the hotel. Hotel is on the top of Chicago Sun Times building and there was a deli in the first floor so this was nice . If you are going to the Merchandise Mart this is the hotel to book as it is connected to it by a pedway.Hotel is also close to the theater district.

Reviews.Title: “Did not get to stay”
Reviews.Author: mwalkerBisbee
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay during the month of October, but circumstances arose that did not let us make the trip as planned. The hotel manager was most accomodating and sympathetic to our situation. I can not say enough to that extent. I hope we will be able to reschedule the trip in the future, and that I will be able to meet the manager and thank him in person.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: myintd
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Inn; won't be the last either. Stayed for a whole week, turned out to be lovely surprise. Reserved a king with river room on the higher floors, very tidy room with awesome view of Sears Towers and the city around. Check out the pool and gym on 16th floor, awesome in the early mornings, no one's there! Great location, connected to the Mart Plaza, close to CTA/buses, short walk restaurants and bars in Streeterville, River North and Clark & Lake.

Reviews.Title: “Second time and still average.”
Reviews.Author: Terriv
Reviews.Content: Checked in and being a platinum club member I received a nice little goodie bag with nuts, chips, cookies, water and a coupon their restaurant. This was a much nicer gift than what Hilton gives out. I was supposedly upgraded to a better room. On the 23rd (top) floor far, far away from the elevator. Not a good location for anyone with walking issues. Or for anyone who is afraid of heights or movement as movement is felt in high winds. The room was OK, decent sized. They need to do some upgrades like get rid of the old hangars in the closet without a door (the kind that you can't steal as if anyone needs to steal a hangar these days) and for goodness sakes remove the old AC units already. What a disgusting disgrace to a room that would be considered above avg. It was dirty, extremely dirty that is, and probably so full of mold. In fact, although I had non-feather pillows in the room I struggled with a terrible headache the two nights I was there and basically didn't sleep. The carpets need to be cleaned as well. Bath & Body Works toiletries which is welcome. Nice water pressure, too. And the room stayed cooled well for being on an upper floor. The bar was nice, great views. The margarita wasn't worth tasting but the mojito was OK. Not very cheap but most hotel bars are not. Since this was my second visit to this hotel I would rather not stay here again but it was an OK choice for the location and the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a business conference”
Reviews.Author: EWandJW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Chicago - Mart Plaza for a week long conference for work. The hotel conference facilities are well-apportioned and accommodated our large and dynamic group very well. The rooms were basic, but offered all of the amenities needed to keep me happy and rested throughout the week.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bermudasoon
Reviews.Content: We arrived at midnight by brown line train and had no trouble finding the hotel. Upon check in I was a little apprehensive about having a priceline room, however, the manager that helped us was very nice. He said even though there was a glitch and we were booked for a couple days later than our dates he will fix it. He also gave us a room on the top floor (23rd) with a view of the skyline and river. Excellent! The weather was in the 50's our entire stay so it was good to be able to go through the Mart to get to the brown line. It was also very close to our fave Doughnut Vault and The Gilt Bar. Housekeeping was very throrough and checked on us every afternoon to see if we needed anything. I found the room nice and made up everyday after sightseeing. Thanks HI Mart for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, Great View of Chicago "Y"”
Reviews.Author: DrCitrus
Reviews.Content: ...not the YMCA, but the "Y" in the Chicago River! The hotel starts on the 15th floor to the 23d of the Chicago Tribune Building next to the Merchandise Mart. It is convenient to the Brown Line of the L, and well within (long) walking distance to the Magnificent Mile, Millenium Park, Sears Tower. The hotel is clean, modern and comfortable if not somewhat Spartan. There is a decent and not inexpensive restaurant and bar on the Lobby Floor. The staff was cordial. Being a member of the Proiority Club got my spouse and I a bottle of water and a bag of peanuts upon our check-in. Again, Spartan--but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Two stays, two totally different experiences”
Reviews.Author: staceyeid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice in the past week, two nights each time. The rooms booked had identical descriptions but were quite different. The first room was on the top floor with a great view looking towards downtown and was very spacious with enough room for our daughters pack n play crib as well as a large picnic blanket spread out on the floor. The room was modern and recently redone. The second room had an identical description but was quite dated and considerably smaller. The water pressure was quite low and the wallpaper was peeling in places. We called the front desk to see if we could switch rooms but there were no other rooms available. If we had this room during our first stay we probably would not have returned. It was clean, but after the first room very disappointing. The hotel overall is in a great location, only about a 20 min walk to the magnificent mile. The hotel staff were very friendly, especially the bellman. If we could be guaranteed a stay in a new larger room we would return in a heartbeat. Otherwise we'll look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view but overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela064
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful and check in and check out easy. The Inn was very good about a late check out time with no hassles. Location is very good and the view from the room was fantastic. However, the rooms were average and for a hotel with room prices over $200 a night we would expect a bit more in decor.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views - but hotel needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: 2dkdkd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great central location (on top of the Sun Times building) - next to Merchandise Mart and walking distance from both the L and Michigan Avenue. The service was friendly and the hotel bar overlooks the river. The rooms have great sweeping views of the both the river and the skyline. It was spatious and well equipped with a desk and outlets to recharge laptops/phones etc. The only drawback is that the bathroom desparately needs an update, as does the furniture in the room. Apart from that, it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Scuba_Doc
Reviews.Content: My family recently went to Chicago to see all the sights and stores. We found Holiday Inn Chicago - Mart Plaza to be a fantastic place to stay. The room and entire hotel area were perfectly clean. The view from our room on the 16th floor was fantastic. My wife and daughter liked that the shampoo and lotion were from Bath and Body Works. As previously noted by other reviews, the hotel was very difficult to locate. The riverfront location limits access, but also limits noise. The hotel is quite as a church. I slept like a log. We are Platinum Members and paid for our room with points. Platinum Members get a goody bag at check in. We got an upgrade to a mini-suite. The extra space was handy. We were in a nice corner room with very comfortable beds. There is free wi-fi. We could see both the Willis Tower and the Hancock Building from our room. The room we had overlooked the river and downtown. The hotel is on top of the Chicago Sun Times building and is connected to the Merchandise Mart by a pedway. The pedway closes at 7 PM. There is a food court and subway stop in the Merchandise Mart. Buses are equally handy. We got 3 day metro passes ($14) and never moved our car after parking ($36 per day). We walked to dinner most nights. Carsonâ€™s Steak House is only 5 blocks away. To enter the hotel, you go in the Sun Times building and take one elevator to 15th floor, which is the hotel lobby. You take another set of elevators to go to your room. We enjoyed the fitness center and swimming pool. A sauna is also at the pool. There is a flat screen TV in the room and a coffee maker. Our room had a college size refrigerator. There is a deli type store in the lobby of the Sun Times. But even better is the CVS just down the street which sells groceries and Metro passes. We got terrific information from the concierge and bellmen. When we return to Chicago, we will definitely stay here again. Kudos to GM Tony Miu for running such a fine operation. I hope you found this information to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent, in my estimation. The rooms were reasonably priced, clean and spacious. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The view from the room was quite stunning. I most certainly will return to this property in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, impressive hotel and room.”
Reviews.Author: stillwigirl
Reviews.Content: I travel for work alot and was surprised by this property- I don't typically stay at Holiday Inn usually Marriott. But WOW! This hotel was a nice change of pace. Rooms were clean and huge. Property looks newer and was impressed by the staff. Friendly and accomodating. Location was great- and you walk all the way to the Food Court of Merchandise Mart without even going outside! I would stay here again when in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Croydongal
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Holiday Inn Mart Plaza. The hotel itself is of a good standard. Typical of a Holiday Inn so at least you know you are getting quality. My room on the 19th floor was clean and large. The view of the sky line (which included the Sears Tower - now known as Willis Tower) was fantastic. The room was starting to get a bit tired though and needs to be updated. The double beds in the room are very small. Luckily I was alone in my room, but could not imagine sharing that bed with another person. It would get very cosy! However I liked the fact my room was cleaned every day and was absolutely spotless. The location of the hotel is not bad. There are some decent restaurants and bars near by. Also close to the Financial district and the Loop transport system. Nearest station to take you to and from O'Hare is Clark Street station, and with train fares of only $2.75 is cheap as chips and an ideal way to travel between the hotel and airport. While you are at the station you should definitely get a breakfast from Ronny's (amazing!!) Although close to the Financial district it is a bit further away from the shopping of Michigan Avenue. But it is a lovely 15 minute or so stroll along the river front. Robert the concierge is fantastic and extremely helpful. He knows everything and will go the extra mile. Unfortunately though not all the staff are as helpful and polite as Robert. There are some staff at the check-in desks who would benefit from a little customer service training, and the odd smile really doesn't hurt. When asking one of the check-in desk girls for help really was like trying to get blood out of a stone and just full of the same robotic answer. I didn't eat here so can't comment on the food, but the bar is a very relaxing environment to sit enjoy a few drinks whilst taking in the fantastic Chicago skyline. Would I come back here? Not sure to be honest. Would maybe try to get a hotel on Michigan Avenue if I were to return to Chicago, but it really is a charming city with heaps of personality.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view”
Reviews.Author: nymca
Reviews.Content: This is smart decent and effective business hotel in the Loop in Chicago. You don't stay here to linger in the hotel. You stay here because it is at the heart of the city. The room I had was large with all the comforts you need and a good bed. The bathroom was clean and well cleaned. My only problem was that my shower when I had to leave very early to catch the flight to DC was only just warm. Disappointing. The glory of the hotel though is the awesome view of the city as the hotel sits on the top of the Sun Times Building. Food is hotel standard - it won't do you any harm but you will quickly forget it. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: debatecoach
Reviews.Content: So most of the reviews of this property seem spot on. We asked for a room with a view, used points for the stay, and the view was spectacular. WE took some great photos, and it was beautiful and night and day. I think since it is right by the water that thee can't be a building right next to it, so the views are better than a lot of hotels, also due to fact that the hotel is up on high floors (starting at 15th floor, I think). So, PROS 1- views 2- access to public transportation, you have to walk a bit, but you don't have to go outside (if you go to CVS about a block away, you can purchase a day pass for subway, train, etc. for about 5 dollars- good deal). 3- free wifi 4- value for the room for Chicago is good 5 extra treat bag if platinum member 6 access to taxis- there's always several there, and to get to most places downtown (aquarium, field museum, etc) should only cost you about ten dollars and take about 15 minutes or less. Sometimes this is really easier than trying to take public transportation, since you are relatively close to a lot of stuff 7 concierge is very helpful- let them help you- you don't need to figure out the subway map, etc. Either use walking Garmin GPS or ask concierge instead of looking at maps online, etc. CONS- Getting luggage to room- they have a bellman if you want to pay, though. Strongly suggest you pull car over at entrance (you can leave for 15 minutes of so) and take luggage up from there. You have to go in lobby, take one elevator to 15th floor, then go through hotel lobby to another set of elevators to go to room. Sounds harder than it is, but much better if you have rolling luggage. Don't park the car and then take luggage up steps, etc just to get back to lobby entrance- that'll wear you out. Parking- although to be honest parking is expensive everywhere- it costs about 40 a day- but you can come and go as you please. Just remember to take ticket to registration at check in so they can validate it- don't leave in the car. Then they can put charges for it and link it to your credit card on file so it will get paid automatically. There are some other surface lots we could see from our room, but they don't look easy to get to, and I am not sure how much cheaper they would be. Parking everywhere is expensive unless you can find a meter downtown (good luck with that). It's just the going rate there, and I'm from Kentucky so it was bit of a shock. WE found that combination of taxis and public transport was cheaper than trying to take car around city and pay parking. no free breakfast- not a holiday inn express, but I often get free voucher for breakfast at holiday inn with platinum status. Not a big deal, though. We are connected to a plaza that has Dunkin Donuts, Au Bon Pain, etc. and that is fine if you want to save money and not use room service, etc. All in all, a good stay. Great room, good value for price anyway, and convenient to a lot of downtown Chicago compared to staying outside city. You can stay out in suburbs to save money, but you will have to fight traffic and still eat significant parking charges (like 25 for two hours, etc.), so this is easier.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: WallyDog
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and comfortable with a spectacular view. The bathroom was spotless and I loved that the toiletries were from Bath and Bodyworks. There is very easy access to public transportation. My one complaint is having to take one elevator to the lobby, walk across the lobby and then take a different elevator to the street. But we would still return to the hotel on another trip.

Reviews.Title: “You're paying for the view”
Reviews.Author: missjazzsinger
Reviews.Content: The room was small. The atmosphere was definately not family. The restraunt downstairs was mediocre. The decor was bleh. The customer service was poor. The parking was outrageous ($38). And my GPS had a difficult time finding the hotel.The location was ok, pretty central. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mkendrick
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find with a sat nav. If driving, pull up at the front doors, in front of the taxi stand and wait for the doorman to help unload your bags onto the cart. You then pull away from the front door, bear left and down a spiral ramp, collect a ticket, park up, and ascend some steps back up to street level. There are express elevators to the the 15th floor reception, where checking in was quick and easy, and the staff friendly and efficient. The room we had overlooked the river and downtown and the views are spectacular. The room was clean and the beds comfortable, and there is free internet access if you obtain the access code from front desk. There is flat screen TV in the rooms and tea and fresh brewed coffee making facilities. I would not describe the decor as being tired, but standard for this type of hotel. Cityscape Bar next to reception is a pleasant place to people watch, or catch a game on TV, or simply take in the surrounding Chicago buildings. There is no doubt it is a dramatic place to enjoy an drink. However, the drinks are somewhat expensive, most beers are $7.00 or more. You do need to be careful with your card keys, as any magnetic source, even your phone, will erase these, and you will then have to go to reception to get the card renewed. This also goes for the parking ticket. The hotel is surrounded by bars and restaurants so don't worry about getting food and drink at good value prices while staying here. Just in front of the express elevators leading up to the reception is a small store, which sells deli food and drink as well as a selection of gifts. The parking charge is excessive, though in keeping with the rest of the city, where parking spaces are at a premium. Interestingly, having read sheilaUpholland's review, we were charged $36.00 per night for self parking rather than $38.00. Despite these extra costs the hotel is well situated, the rooms spacious and pleasant with great views in most, and the staff visible, friendly, helpful and efficient. So I would have to recommend this hotel if you are staying in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: 523HappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were attending a reunion of her hospital unit from the Vietnam War era; attended by more than 90 people.We had a river view room with a queen bed. The view from our room was worth the price of the room. From the moment we checked in, we were impressed with the outstanding front desk and housekeeping staff. The concierge went above and beyond providing outstanding service. When he found that we had made dinner arrangements at Keefer's, an excellent steak house, at the end of our meal, our server informed us that our dessert was courtesy of the hotel concierge. I am a disabled veteran with special dietary needs that the restaurant cheerfully accomodated. Great food at a reasonable price. Overall, our experience in Chicago was equal to that of the top hotels of Bangkok, Shanghai, Kathmandu, or New Delhi.

Reviews.Title: “Not your old, mediocre Holiday Inn--spectacular city views and service”
Reviews.Author: TXPhD11
Reviews.Content: My school, The Chicago School of Professional Psychology, is nearby, so this is a great place to stay whenever I must stay nearby for working weekends, etc. When I think, "Holiday Inn" I imagine the very mediocre-yet-reliable small hotel/motel my family used to stay in on road trips years ago. So when Holiday Inn revamped and re-emerged in recent years, I avoided the chain! Well, I may have to reconsider after my experience here. It was great! The hotel is nice with a great Asian flavor restaurant and a bar area with all windows--great city views. The hotel is conveniently located in downtown Chicago for shopping, dining, and the merchandise/design area. Rooms are nice--not luxury but updated and very comfortable. Ask for a room on a high floor (I was on 21st floor) to enjoy the AMAZING city lights! It's right on the river so it's pretty during the day as well. One evening my classmate and I needed to get a lot of work done so did not want to spend an hour or so going to eat dinner at a restaurant. I called downstairs to ask if we could order food and come down to get it in order to use our 15% member discount and to avoid room service fees. I was told yes. However, once I arrived there had been a misunderstanding and we were charged as though the food had been prepared and brought to our room. I politely relayed that I did not understand this and within minutes of returning to my room a manager called me and brought a refund and restaurant coupon up to my room. Very nice! It's sooooo nice to get this kind of response when I didn't even have to gripe or be mean. The manager explained that they appreciate my membership in the Holiday Inn rewards club and they'd of course rather have us eating food here than ordering food elsewhere. Good overall experience. One of the lesser-expensive, better options of the hotels for this expensive area.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel had everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: sheilaUpholland
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel as part of a route 66 self drive tour. The hotel was quite Central in Chicago. We were able to walk along michigan boulivard along the canals. The hotel overlooked the water. The only thing that dis surprise me was the carparking costs at the hotel at $38 per night. The pool was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Kashay
Reviews.Content: My first time staying at a Holiday Inn and this was a pleasant surprise. The rooms were clean and kept up by housekeeping for the entire stay (and we had a large group over 2 connecting rooms). The bar downstairs was not too pricey but still nice. The views are great. We walked to all of the locations we wanted to go around Chicago from the hotel. Cabs were right outside for the few times we did need a cab. Free Internet. Food delivery options for late night ordering. The bathrooms do not have ventilation/fan so it did get steamed up easy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lakedog200069
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in August and we were happy with the location, room, bar and workout facilities. Room was clean and bedding was extremely comfortable. Staff we encountered were all helpful and personable.

Reviews.Title: “Save Money staying a few blocks away...priority benefits provided even with Priceline reservation!”
Reviews.Author: GBCheesehead
Reviews.Content: My first time at this hotel...even though I booked on Priceline, I still got the free Internet and Priority welcome gift bag! Rooms are nice, staff was friendly. I had a great river and city view...and only a few blocks from Michigan Ave...easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Better than central hotels”
Reviews.Author: Froggggie
Reviews.Content: Located slightly outside the main part of city centre, easy to access via the brown metro line. Only issue is the 10 min walk through the mart plaza to get to the metro station. Not really a problem on weekdays however on Sunday's the plaza closes and it isn't well signposted to help get to the street level to walk round to hotel. Hotel located above the street level therefore need to find the lift to get to the lobby. Rooms spacious but cannot understand why they don't give you a refridgerator in the rooms?Bathroom is quite small though. Moderate sized indoor swimming pool, I went when it was quite in the hotel, therefore had pool to myself....fab! Around the hotel, there isn't much to do. Don't bother waiting for the bus opposite the hotel, takes too long, if you need to try the bus then walk up to the next road however probably quicker to take the metro to the loop and then take the red line to the shopping mile. Navigating the metro system is very easy in Chicago. Don't forget to buy a week metro ticket at the airport machine though especially if staying a week as it makes it easier being a tourist. unless you are going on a lot of buses, you need the basic ticket as the ticket allows you on their chicago transit buses as well. Just don't take the blue buses which need the ticket with the extra payment.

Reviews.Title: “i'll definitely recommend it”
Reviews.Author: igcolon
Reviews.Content: I was there from Sept 1-6, and it was great. Friendly and available staff. Room without a city view, but available for $20 per night. I will definitely go back and will recommend it without reservations, given that you are OK with not being in the center of the action, but just a 10 min. walk to the loop.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: MomaMac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, and I was pleasantly surprised, especially because of reading reviews. Keep in mind this hotel is on the edge of the action, so if you are not keen on walking or taking transit, this hotel won't be for you. Its a good 15 min walk over to Michigan Ave. not bad on a sunny, warm day. We had a south facing view, overlooking the city, it was awesome. Rooms are really clean, comfortable, bathrooms are nicely updated. There are some good restaurants in the area, if you want to try a real deep dish pizza, head to Lou Malnati's on Wells. The parking is outdoor, and for $36/day you have in and out privileges. The door man Johnny was a great help with were to eat and see. Got AAA rate which was really good. If you have really small kids, you may want to find something closer, but my two little people really enjoyed it. The staff aren't super friendly but they were efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Pricelined this hotel and was totally impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca N
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, and I traveled to Chicago with my parents. We used Priceline to get two hotel rooms - we got a great rate ($99/night) and were quite impressed. The rooms were reasonably sized and we had a great view of the river. We were within a 15 minute walk to Navy Pier and other great attractions. Good location if you want to see the city. Nice property with good staff. Oh, and I LOVE staying at a Holiday Inn and getting free internet - you never get that at a Ritz!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay - great in-out parking for downtown.”
Reviews.Author: TeresaN_11
Reviews.Content: Our family of four drove to Chicago in the family Suburban. I was a little worried about parking but the Holiday Inn MartPlaza has an open air parking lot just outside the front doors and while it was a bit hard to find at first once we got oriented to where it was in relation to all other places we were going it was great. Found a great rate online that included free parking (a big deal when comparing rates!). Room was clean and quiet and we enjoyed our stay. (Did not eat at inhouse restaurant so I can't comment on that; we found breakfast and dinner elsewhere) Love Chicago's museums and aquarium and Skydeck. Buy a CityPass! Best way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PilotguyPA28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location. The room was clean and the bed was nice. Breakfast was quite expensive (to me) at abut $20pp for a buffet. I received a free voucher for it but not all do. Fairly convenient to the "L" Train and a short taxi ride to a lot of places. DO NOT take a shuttle or taxi from Midway (or O'Hare). It took the same amount of time with the "L" and was only $2.25 verses about $25. The shuttles will drop you off at the front door and with the "L" you have to walk about 1 block. Never used the workout area or pool. Staff was very friendly. I was there 3 days. Price was good and I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel price good, nice location, but service sub-par ...”
Reviews.Author: GBo_32
Reviews.Content: This was an okay hotel overall. Good points: good price with the car stay free package, clean overall (no bed bugs)! Location and views from hotel were good. Bad points: restaurant in hotel lobby is over priced. Staff wasn't very helpful, requested extra towels one morning but never received them. Also, the bell-hops weren't very helpful, a bit rude. Even though it was a good price, I probably will stay somewhere else the next time I'm in Chicago. I would recommend only because I usually have good experiences at Holiday Inn hotels. Maybe the staff just had a bad weekend ...

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms better than others”
Reviews.Author: martygSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on two occasions. If you get a room with a window facing the outside, the views can be stunning, and the rooms are nice. If you get a room with an interior window - facing the light shaft, they are gloomy and claustrophibic. Pros. Quite good value for Chicago. Easy access to the El Price includes internet access. Some rooms have magnificent views. Cons: Not at all central for the main tourist districtis...you are going to have to get a train. Not close to many good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities, rooms look a bit 1990s though”
Reviews.Author: co_fragment
Reviews.Content: A great location on the river with easy access to the middle of Chicago. The lobby is actually on the 15th floor and looks great, newly decorated and modern. There is a restaurant that we didn't try and a corner cocktail bar with great views of the city and prices you'd expect (my cocktail was about $10). The guest service seemed fine, although we didn't make much use of it. The rooms look like any other Holiday Inn though and don't look like they've been renovated in over ten years, it's clean, but just looks tired and for the price per room was a little disappointing. Maybe they hope the wonderful views make up for it. The rooms were comfortable, with all the usual fixtures and fittings. The A/C worked wonders on one of the hottest nights of the summer! So while we stayed to attend a wedding there and got a slight cut in the rates because of this, I still felt it was a little over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprized”
Reviews.Author: NeRock04
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three weeknights after getting a deal on Priceline. I absolutely loved my stay. Although the hotel isn't as close to State /Michigan as others, it is still located in walking distance or a short taxi ride (taxis are always waiting right outside the lobby) to whatever downtown destination you choose. It's also right across from the Merchandise Mart with a connecting bridgeway for easy access. The view from my room was absolutely amazing. I could see the river (the span of about 6 bridges) and the buildings all lit up at night. The also have a bar with an amazing view- you can sit for drinks or order from the hotel's restaurant menu. I've stayed at some of the more pricey hotels in downtown Chicago and many of them do not offer great views (unless you can afford the penthouse). There was a nice sized pool and fitness center. The rooms could definitely use some updating but still very clean, cute and comfortable. I thought I would be taking a chance at whatever I could get just to make my trip affordable but it turned out to be a great treat. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: travel4sushi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location if a little complicated to get to the actual hotel. Getting to the room requires using two different sets of elevators and some "winding about." The hotel does have some remarkable views of the Chicago skyline that would be a good reason to stay here. Other than that the hotel is just a typical Holiday Inn in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: happyfamilyMacomb_Il
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel after staying 2 nights(July 24th-26th). Got this on priceline for $100 per night, though parking is $36 per night...still not bad for downtown Chicago. This hotel is in the Chicago Sun Times building, near the river. The hotel is actually on the 15th floor, so you have a bit of a walk to get to elevator, then to lobby, then to elevators to your rooms. The staff is great, and the rooms are nice. We had a view of the pool which was a covered pool the kids loved. The Sky bar has a beautiful view, though drinks are a bit cashy, as well as the restaurant. We opted to walk to a CVS for breakfast snack food. The hotel is located centrally and we were able to walk to plenty of shopping on State Street and Michigan Ave. We would stay here again, but would prefer an even better location near the loop or MIchigan Ave. however with priceline you really never know where you'll end up if you choose the discount over an exact location. Still a nice place..not perfect but very nice. We did find several fast food restaurants in the merchandise mart which is connected to this building. They do give you a code for free internet access if you have an ipad or laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on the Chicago River”
Reviews.Author: WoknOnAir
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a conference at this hotel and we stayed here for several nights. It can be easily reached from the airport by train as there is a station right in the building...how convenient! That fact alone made our stay in Chicago so easy as we took the train to go shopping, to see a concert & the museums, and also to connect easily to the Metra station to go out to the University of Chicago. The hotel itself is very modern in decor and very busy. Even when busy, we felt that we were well taken care of by the staff and also had a very nice dinner in the lobby restaurant. As others have mentioned, the views are phenomenal from the bar and the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price, off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: foxy_mom4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older, but very clean. Friendly staff and close affordable parking with in and out privileges. It can be a little difficult to get to your room, as the hotel is actually on top of another business. However, once you find all the elevators, this is much easier to navigate. We did not realize we could stop in front of the hotel and drop all our luggage off when we checked in. This would have made our first few hours easier, rather than carrying all our baggage up the stairs or through the handicap accessible entrance. Make sure to use the taxi/drop off lane when checking in. The pool was nice and warm and very large. Sometimes difficult to secure towels. We had a double bed room, which was VERY large. The beds were small, but the room was very nice. The view of the river and Merchandise Mart was outstanding. The hotel is off the beaten path for a lot of sightseeing tours, but within walking distance. Taxi cabs were always waiting in the front, and easily accessible. An in-room mini fridge would have been nice, as there was no breakfast included (however there is a restaurant in the hotel) and with two younger children, drinks and snacks in the room are a must. We stayed for three nights, and enjoyed our time in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: kingandiWindsor_ON
Reviews.Content: Went for my daughters 13yr birthday. Although we were promised a "river view" the first day we didn't get it. They changed their tune to say they "try" to accomidate requests but don't guarentee it (quite different to when I booked it) Did move the next day however(after alot of complaining). The whinning was worth it. Spectacular views of the river from the 20'th floor. Parking $36/night; extra rollaway $20/night. Factor these when booking. More upscale than most "Holiday Inns". Mediocore restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good but difficult to access.”
Reviews.Author: jmorgan_huntsville
Reviews.Content: The room was confortable and clean. The view overlooking the the river was was wonderful. The public areas were spacious and attractive. However, there were long check in lines. It was almost impossible to reach the consierge desk by phone and when I did get through the man was rude and condesending. The evening I went to the bar it was impossible to get served. The hotel is the top portion of a building that has has an entrance which is difficult to locate. Once inside the building, one must first locate a bank of elevators that goes to the hotel and then walk down a hall way to the hotel lobby. There are many resturants and entertainment venues in the area but is difficult to get in and out of the hotel to enjoy them. The building is connected to the Trade Mart which makes it easy to do business there. The price of the accomodation was reasonable but I would look for a more accessible hotel on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: RollsUK
Reviews.Content: I have slept in many hotels in Chicago, as once or twice a year I am visiting. About 4 years ago I happened to book a room there and I have never changed my hotel ever since. The rooms are lovely, the views from the hotel are stunning, the staff is friendly, restaurant is good, the location is perfect for the Loop area, but also Michigan Avenue and North Halsted area. And the blue line from the airport stops in walking distance. It is all perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Guests Hotel - Location, View 5 star”
Reviews.Author: njm0058
Reviews.Content: Although our daughter's wedding was not held here, we did use it for our guests from out of town and who wanted to stay in the city to enjoy all Chicago has to offer. The sales team I worked with for our room block was friendly, efficient, and easy to work with -- it made this MOB lessen her nerves. They even accommodated my calls to make sure cribs and beds were as we asked. My upgraded room was a view unmatched in a corner overlooking the Chicago River south and east. The bar on the 15th floor/lobby has the same wonderful view. Parking was a bit confusing, pay daily or does hotel automatically put the $36 parking fee on your bill, etc. Front desk cleared it up easily. A problem with a cancelled room was easily remedied by the wonderful and kind night floor manager who was very accommodating. Comfy bed, clean room and a large room. I should have stayed in it longer but we were very busy. We did fit about 12 people in the room just to visit for a short time. We did not eat here, but there is a food court adjacent to the hotel in the Merchandise Mart which is easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Went above and beyond to ensure we had a fantastic stay - Happy to recommend to anyone visiting Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: snowday
Reviews.Content: Tony Mui, General Manager did all he could to ensure that our family had a fantastic stay at this wonderful hotel. My family of 4 planned a last minute getaway to the windy city so that my husband and son could visit Wrigley Field and take in a Cubs game. We planned our stay for July 1 - 4, 2011 and booked rather confidently with Hotwire and were fortunate enough to land this accomodation. Immediately I was worried about how a room with 2 double beds would meet our needs, travelling with our children,one of whom has special needs. After getting nowhere with Hotwire in disputing the Queen vs Double issue and with limited assistance (due to their own restrictions, not due to a lack of understanding) with the reservations department, I decided to contact Tony Miu directly, after seeing his name and responses to these Trip Advisor posts. Tony immediately appreciated our predicament and ensured that we would be well accomodated for our stay to meet each family members needs, and also went above and booked us an additional night at our request, at a discounted rate - which unfortunately I later had to cancel (as I was ill and we ended our travel plans rather abruptly) with no difficulty at all. I could not have asked for better customer service. Our room was spectacular, the views were enthralling and the room was far better than expected, a Junior Suite. I was so pleased with Tony's interest in meeting our needs, and requested to meet with him directly to express our gratitude. He was gracious and kind to my husband, children and I at a busy time, as my little one showed her impatience during our brief interaction. The rooms are fresh, beautfully appointed with calm and relaxation in mind. We will most certainly recommend this hotel to our friends and family, and will certainly come again, on another visit to Chicago. As stated earlier, I was hit with a bout of illness that resulted in an early departure, that was again kindly accomodated at the front desk with an empathetic and hassle free goodbye and checkout. Thank you so much Tony and staff, for a most pleasant albiet brief stay. Until next time....

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased and will return”
Reviews.Author: marytrip11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 4th weekend and were so sad to leave our fabulous hotel. The hotel is connected to the Merchandise Mart, so we can easy indoor access to the CTA brown line train AND a food court (McDonalds, Dunkin Donuts, Arby's, Quizno's, Japenese, BarBQ, etc..). This was so convenient, and would be a HUGE plus during the cold, snowy months. Our room view was so incredible that we slept with the curtains open so we could enjoy the nighttime city view throughout the night. Our room was clean, huge, and so comfortable. We would HIGHLY recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, going back again next week”
Reviews.Author: dersnuka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over a 4 day weekend last year over Labor Day and it was spectacular. I'd never been in downtown Chicago, despite my wife having lived here for a couple of years. The hotel itself was great, everybody was nice and the service was outstanding. As a platinum member of their Priority Club, I was given an upgrade to a corner king bed suite for no additional charge. We are going there again in a few days for our 5th anniversary the week of July 3rd-9th and I had to stay here. The location is perfect, you're in almost the center of Chicago. I would highly recommend this hotel to couples, but it also looks great for the business traveler as well. Can't wait to get there in just a few days!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Bad!!!/"incomplete" advertising”
Reviews.Author: RarelyaReviewer
Reviews.Content: Had previously informed hotel that our family included an 87-year-old who needed a wheelchair. Path from parking lot to our rooms was RIDICULOUS. Outdoor parking lot ($36/24 hrs), up about 50 outdoor steps, across two vehicular lanes, through building lobby area about 30 yards, elevator to 15th floor hotel lobby, another 25 yards to second elevator, then up to floor and finally about 30 yards to room. Reservation was made months in advance. Hate to think of trekking from the parking lot to the front entrance in a Chicago winter. Holiday Inn might have lost a customer for one stay if they had advised me that access was difficult, but now I'll never stay at Holiday Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel for seeing chicago”
Reviews.Author: Matthias086
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 2 days for the start of our route 66 tour. the people at the reception are very friendly and always happy to help. the rooms were very clean when we arrivied. the location next to the river and close to all attractions and the magnificient mile is great. 2 blocks and your downtown chicago. the only downside to the hotel is for the 2 days we stayed, we had to pay 36$ for parking

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, WONDERFUL views”
Reviews.Author: ashleykay081
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking views of the skyline, great service. Expensive to park. Cabs are always readily available. Clean, quiet, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: dpenta
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for a conference in room 2316. Nice hotel, great location, updated rooms, very unlike old-school Holiday Inn - as others commented, more like a Hyatt in general feel/appearance. Friendly front desk clerk at check-in, my room had a great view of the river and beyond. Comfortable bed. Gap below door is large but nothing a towel couldn't fix. Only negative was Gwendolyn who at check-out refused to give me a printed statement until I got nasty about it. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A PERFECT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mkbloom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Chicago at the Mart. It has fast become my top stay in Chicago. Perfectly located and more impressive than I could have expected. The rooms were clean, the hotel is beautiful and the restaurant was surprisingly great. I just read that someone else wrote about the teas. I had green tea at the restaurant. It was the best green tea I have ever tasted. I know why Oprah recommends it. Great job Holiday Inn for attending to the details.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: electrictravel
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful. Loved "Oprah's Favorite" tea served in restaurant -Room was beautiful! I will be back and will bring friends!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Heavenly, Beautiful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Giggles2871
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were given a free night at this hotel as a gift. We are so glad that we used. The room was spacious and beautiful with an AMAZING view of downtown Chicago. We ate dinner at the on-site restaurant, Italiasia. Simply magnificent! Service was impeccable, the hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. The only downside was the cost of overnight parking: $36.00. Ouch! However, that's what to expect in downtown Chicago. Overall, a fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: PC524
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Hotwire for a fast summer trip to the Windy City. The hotel is somewhat odd in that it is located on top of another business, but other than that it is a really nice hotel. We walked almost everywhere that we went downtown from the hotel, so its location was very convenient for us. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “ok value for the price, but....”
Reviews.Author: sleepycapt
Reviews.Content: Responses from management try to get the word "upscale" in there at least six times. to be sure, this is not the worst hotel near the loop, but it is NOT "upscale." like most all HI's, this is NOT a new or renovated property. this is clearly an older property which has been papered over to look nice. which it does, if you don't look too close. the hotel section of this office building is on the top floors. the lobby, on the 15th floor, has been redone. you can't help but notice that all the functional amenities are still the originals. the elevators have been decorated, but not redone. they are old and slow and crowded. it is a two-stage process to get to your room from the entry. the ventilation is the old type with new controls, same with bathrooms. all of which is fair, but the noise control is a real issue. there is a huge gap under your door (you could even LOOK into someone's room if you were so inclined). and with this, people talking in the halls sound like they are IN THE ROOM WITH YOU. if your room is near the elevator, there is a lot of noise from that. shower pressure is poor and internet speed is G-L-A-C-I-A-L. the lobby does look nice and the cityscape bar is beautiful. we did not try the food. the view from our room was spectacular, overlooking the river. it was a good size, and had a fridge. the location is not bad, though definitely not in the center of the action. there are plenty of places within walking distance if the weather is warm, otherwise by cab. the L is nearby. staff was helpful and friendly. for the price, this is not a terrible option, if you are ok with the various issues here. you can pay a lot more over on michigan av.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and undergood.”
Reviews.Author: ECN914
Reviews.Content: We paid a pretty penny for a mediocre room in this odd hotel, which has all the ambiance of a football stadium. (Indeed, the stadium comes to you in the lobby, with mammoth TV screens playing either sports or violent police programs--so appropriate for families!) The hotel is not within easy walking distance of many decent restaurants--speaking of which, if you do stay here, do NOT ask the concierge desk for any help with anything! You'll do better finding places at random. One restaurant we were referred to was a real dive, and teeming with teenagers (seriously: dozens and dozens of them!). Another, when we asked for a breakfast recommendation (how hard is it to make a decent breakfast?) was actually not open when we got there, and when it did open, it was truly the worst breakfast we ever had.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO STAY IN DOWNTOWN CHICAGO!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tonystrout
Reviews.Content: The front desk and valet staff were friendly and helpful at check in, my room was very clean and comfortable. Exactly what you would expect from a high end downtown hotel. The facility itself is designed very nicely. I did not eat in the restaurant so can't comment on the food and drinks, but compared to other hotel brands, including the other Holiday Inn properties in the down town Chicago area, the Holiday Inn Chicago Mart Plaza is simply the best. Great shopping close by too! I'll definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Why are handicapped accessible rooms so far away from the elevator?”
Reviews.Author: handicappedtravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week, and the only downside was the amount of walking I had to do as a handicapped traveller. The first elevator is towards the back of the building, and that only takes you up to the lobby. From there, another elevator takes the guests up to the hotel floors, and I estimate that the handicapped accessible rooms are 150 yards away from the elevator - hard work for anyone with walking aids or wheelchairs. Once inside the room, the handicapped facilities were excellent. A walk in shower with handrails in the right places - I have to say there wasn't a huge amount of water pressure, but that doesn't bother me. The bed was as comfortable as can be, and I slept well every night. They have refrigerators on a first come first served basis, so if you need one for medication purposes, it's best to call in advance to try and reserve one. I only ate breakfast at the hotel, and if you don't have it included it in your rate, it's a little expensive at $20 per person. However, there is plenty of choice, and the staff were all ever so helpful helping me take my food and drink back to the table. As much as I enjoyed the hotel, I would only stay again if the accessible rooms were close to the elevators. For general travellers, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Ruby1201
Reviews.Content: I'd like to point out that the people there are wonderful. They were warm and friendly, made my stressful 5 night stay so much bearable. The breakfast's great though I can't say much about the rest of the meals at Italiasia. A fast internet connection too. I just wish that they change their room heating system which is very noisy, it's like having an AC blower machine inside the room. I couldn't hear the television over the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Whodat504
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a course at the Hotel itself and it was a good hotel....not exceptional, but not bad either. We had a great view of the river and the staff was excellent. The rooms were nice and updated. I would say everything was above average except for the workout facility which was poor and the internet service was spotty. The hotel isn't in the best location, but is a short walk to the "L" brown train and about a 10-15 min walk to Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view of city, but may not sleep much on weekend with open center floors and bar on 15th floor.”
Reviews.Author: chuckles79
Reviews.Content: Setup of hotel is odd.
