Parking is not under the building, it is an outdoor lot that you must walk up approx. 20 steps or go down a ramp to a low lit door that you need to have them buzz you in to get to the elevators/escalators to the main building. Once in the main building, take another elevator to the 15th floor to the Holiday Inn's front desk. Once checked in, you take a third set of elevators to the floor that you stay on. The particular weekend we stayed there was not a very peaceful sleep weekend since the hallways are on the outside of the square and it is open in the middle and the bar with loud patrons were there until after 3 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Expensive for a RoomView, But Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: RetiredArmyRANGER
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in Chicago for a leisure trip with my wife. Using my PC points I received a king bed with view on the 20th floor. The hotel starts on the 15th floor of the building it sits on. Slept pretty good, the room view was great as we had mostly clear skies. Bed was just right. Water pressure was weak. However, the staff are like any other "Big City" hotel. Short spoken, get to the point, no room for conversation and unlike some of the other reviews I read before booking this trip; NOT helpful. Beware of the Chicago Parking Scams while your there if it's your 1st time (Ticket your car, even though you paid because your out of town) (YES, THIS HAPPENED TO US). Average cost is $3.00 for 2 hours for the "Pay to Park". Easier if you find a all day garage (Usually around $14 a day). PRO: Location CON: Parking fees $36 a day Thanks PC Gold Member

Reviews.Title: “the most memorable hotel i ever stayed at...”
Reviews.Author: luna6373
Reviews.Content: well i won a two nights stay at this hotel at a raffle Thru work i didn't expect much just another downtown hotel expensive food/parking and the hustle and bustle of the down town crown since I'm from the nwside of the city... got to the front desk which is located in the merchandise mart building omg its huge never been in there but i was impressed to say the least the front desk staff/lady was very polite and attentive and friendly she validated my parking slip card upon checking us in i asked if there was a chance for a upgrade she said NO instantly OK no problem then another older woman came over whispered something to her i didn't think anything of it they ask who was with me i said my daughter and its a dad and daughters weekend and she was the lucky one to share my free hotel weekend with thay both smiled and then went on with there business so after chech in she tells us where to go the lobby is huge with long couches nice rugs little places to sit and chat before we went to the room we wanted to see the pool omg it was amazing with a work out room and i skylight above the pool this was better then the Ritz so we get to our room and there's 2 doors I'm like that's not our that's the cleaning room well it was our s the wonderful outgoing desk manager up graded us to the honeymoon suite i was floored i went down and said thank you a million times and when me and my daughter talk about our favorite places and hotels we've stayed the holiday inn mart is our number one we recommend it to everyone the breakfast is also amazing all you can eat and its good too

Reviews.Title: “Very nice facilities with comfortable clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: tuckerbear
Reviews.Content: Hotel had convenient facilities within the location. The location was a bit west of the main action of the city of Chicago, but still within very easy walking distance of everything. It was quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of the center of the city. The service at Italiasia was terrific in that we were in a hurry and they accomodated us extremely well, however the check-in staff was not the most pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: SushiFoodie
Reviews.Content: We were awarded this hotel through a "name your price" bid, and I would definitely stay here and recommend it to others. The location is great for the theater district, shopping and dining. It's a short walk to downtown attractions, and since the hotel is built on top of another building, the views are great. Rooms were pretty standard and clean. The in-room coffee maker and Bath & Body Works lotion was a nice touch. My only complaint about the room is that the bathroom fan is right above the shower, so even with the water turned quite hot, the air was cold. There was also a strange clicking noise coming from behind the wall above the bed -- I think perhaps the heating system. Nothing we couldn't live with, but the cold shower air was unfortunate. We forgot our bathing suits but went down to check out the pool. Lots of little kids there, but it was pretty good sized. We'll check it out next time, because we'll definitely be returning here for our Chicago weekends.

Reviews.Title: “WOW..this is a Holiday Inn ..”
Reviews.Author: basildogpuppy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holliday Inn for the second time in three months !! I would never believe that I would be saying that !!! To begin with the location of this hotel sucks, I wish we would have stayed at the other Holiday Inn which we have stayed at before, because it is so much closer to everything. If Holliday Inn would not have been written in this hotel, I would have thought we where at the W where we frequent. I have only wonderful things to say about both of our visits. The lobby, bar and reception area where first class and very impressive !! The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful. The rooms where extremely nice and modern, the bedding and linens where very high class and the bed was very comfortable. We where sad that we where not staying longer !!!!!! This is a great hotel especially for the rate we paid !! But just make sure you understand the location, it is rather far from most of the downtown activities !!

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected from Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: JackieHud
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest Holiday Inn in which I have ever stayed. The room was large, the view was beautiful and it was clean. I was in a king room on the 23rd floor with a view overlooking the river. I traveled with just a carry-on, so did not bring my own toiletries and found the shampoo, conditioner, and lotion were all very nice. The bed had a choice of soft or firm pillows. We had brunch at Italiasia. It was a nice, but typical, breakfast buffet. We also had drinks at the bar overlooking the city. While they were very pricy ($80 for four of us), it was a nice atmosphere. It was easy to get a cab, there were good restaurants around, but it was not close to shopping, unless you are shopping for pricy furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: joanieJoliet_IL
Reviews.Content: We love the location of this hotel. We stayed on the 21st floor that over looked the river at Wolf pointe. Very nice view. Easy to get around. The staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Record snowfall cancelled my trip, but my pre-trip experience sold me”
Reviews.Author: wendywwBrighton
Reviews.Content: This is an odd review, unlike any others that I have previously written. I was scheduled to speak at a meeting at the Willis Tower (formerly the Sears Tower) in downtown Chicago on Friday, February 4th. As a result, I was doing a scan of all the mid-priced hotels that were within walking distance. Once I had narrowed my search down to 2 or 3 hotels, I went to TripAdvisor to check out the recent reviews and ratings. All of the ratings for January for were VERY positive, but there were two ratings in mid-December that caused me some concern. I was, however, impressed that the Hotel Manager had responded to all of the comments, both positive and not so, and that he had included his email address in one of them so that the rater could contact him to discuss her concerns further. I decided to take advantage of the email address and sent my own email, expressing both interest and concern. I decided to include my phone number after my signature in case anyone cared enough to follow-up either by email or phone. (I have to admit at this point that I am a Customer Service Director and as actually baiting them a bit.) Less than an hour later, I received a phone call from someone I am presuming to be one of the Assistant Hotel Managers (maybe the Reservations Manager). We played phone tag for a good part of the afternoon, but he (Carlisle) never gave up. We discussed the property and the comments that the reviewers had made in December. By the time we had finished our conversation, I had no qualms at all about making a reservation, and did. Carlisle even insisted that I look him up once we arrived at the hotel. I was really looking forward to our stay at that point. Unfortunately, the record snowfall in Chicago on Tuesday, Feb. 1st, which then moved into southeast Michigan, caused me to change my plans, as I had been planning to drive to Chicago. I called and left a message in the Carlisle's voicemail on Wednesday asking about their cancellation policy as the meeting organizer and I were scheduled to speak Thursday to make a "go/no go" decision. I received a call back from him as soon as he arrived in his office on Thursday morning. When I asked him how his "local" drive had been, he responded that it was "only by the grace of God." That actually triggered me to make my final decision as I didn't want to put my husband I through 200+ miles of "only by the grace of God" driving. Although I wasn't able to actually stay at their property on this trip, I have already committed and will have no qualms about staying there on my next visit because "Carlisle" and "Charnita" (reservations) convinced me that they care about my business, even though I'm only one lone traveller. Well maintained facilities are important and from the reviews it sounds as if they are (much above your average Holiday Inn) but the attitude of the employees and the service they provide from top to bottom is what will really make or break a stay at any property. Kudos to the Holiday Inn Chicago - Mart Plaza! I look forward to staying with you on my next visit to the windy (and sometimes very snowy) city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Crustiviajero
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for a night stop after a ski trip in Vail, CO. My idea was to make a little visit during the morning and take a night flight back to Europe. I arrived very late at night (due to snow in airport) and in the front desk was a very friendly and efficient staff member: he was able to manage me a late check out at 1pm so I could take a shower before going back to the airport. The room was on the 23th floor with nice view to Chicago. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom correct. The only but was a little noise coming from the bathroom airhole...but didn't cause me problem to sleep. Free wifi Regarding the location, it is in the city center...It only took me 15 min to arrive to Sears Tower. Taxi ride from O'Hare Airport 35', 38USD

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, awesome restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: b_siabzoo
Reviews.Content: Came to Chicago for a small vacation during Spring Break and wanted to stay downtown to enjoy the city so we booked the Holiday Inn in Mart Plaza. The hotel actually turned out to be really nice, clean rooms with cable, etc. The room was a little small but that was expected. We did not use the pool since it was usually packed with families and noisy kids, but that was all fine since we spent our days shopping on State street or on Michigan. However, the scenery is amazing! We stayed up every night to look out of our room and enjoy the night scene of Chicago. It was amazing. I suggest paying a little bit more to book the rooms with a scene. Plus, the restaurant in this Holiday Inn is fantastic. THE FOOD IS AMAZING, which surprised us. Try the New York steak with fried tofu, it was amazing. i will be back, especially back to the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: NeilD59
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for a bussiness meeting recently and was impressed with all aspects of the hotel. The rooms were clean and well maintained and the food and service during the meetings was outstanding. I would highly recommmend this hotel to anyone coming to the the Chicago area.

Reviews.Title: “Bottom line: It's a Holiday Inn with some frills”
Reviews.Author: ahnion777
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn at Mart Plaza doesn't look like a "Holiday Inn". They've spent a lot of money making the lobby look very snazzy and the view and location from the lobby are probably one of the best in the city. But once you get to your room, you'll see why it's a Holiday Inn. not to say it's "bad" in any way. But don't let the "4 star" lobby fool you. This is a nicer "3 star". One word of caution: I had a double bed room, and expected (like most other hotels) that the room would have two full size beds. Boy was I wrong. The beds were essentially wider twin bed. If the two people sleeping in one bed didn't have a close relationship before, then they would for sure then. They are really narrow "double beds". Other than that, standard amenities for a Holiday Inn. Great location and can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Was everything we needed on short notice”
Reviews.Author: Duece1623
Reviews.Content: The service was friendly even when we showed up early. The pool was clean and warm. The bar has a nice view. Bed was comfy. Taxi stand in front. View of Chicago... priceless!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hillary107
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible expierence at this hotel. We arrived at 9:30 pm and it took 30 minutes for us to check into the hotel. There were 2 guests in front of us and one was waiting for parking validation. The staff was incredibly slow. We wanted to go to dinner at the hotel, but the empty restaurant had an hour wait at 10 pm. We learned in the end was a blessing because the food was horrible and extremely expensive. Instead we asked the front desk for a reccomendation and he could not really help us. I found the staff the entire trip to be extremely unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre room and service, but the location and view are great.”
Reviews.Author: Shuk9
Reviews.Content: I was surprised they don't make themselves more "user-friendly" -- besides a tiny sign there's no indication you're in the right place. Especially when you can't find someone to help you with your luggage. We had trouble getting a luggage cart and when we asked an employee, he just said â€“ â€œsorry, my shift is overâ€� and left. The best part about our room was the view. Other than that, it was a little run-down. If I had been staying for pleasure rather than business I would definitely have complained and/or requested a different room, but I just didnâ€™t have the time to deal with it. Although Iâ€™m pretty picky about cleanliness, I think even some basic things were ignored. The light switch in the bathroom was disgusting -- COVERED in grime and a layer of dust on top -- I don't think it had been cleaned in decades. The bathroom sink was an undermount, and there was a ring of mold around the entire sink under the lip of the sink. Ew. Toilet wasnâ€™t cleaned thoroughly. Ew. The towels seemed old, and scratchy. Grout was dirty, etc. We were across from a housekeeping room where there always seemed to be several employees hanging out talking loudly to one another. Although the sound-proofing between rooms seems good, the sound from the hallway travels directly through the door. I could literally hear every word they said. Really annoying. The bed was pretty comfortable but the pillows were not, despite their "pillow menu." Itâ€™s been a couple weeks since my stay and I still have a crick in my neck. I think the bedding was fairly new, but it already looked worn. Overall I donâ€™t know if Iâ€™d stay here again. Looks like the renovation money all went into their lobby. The rooms were still shabby, just with new TVs and a pillow menu. But the location and view are great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!!!”
Reviews.Author: CAblossom
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for hotels in Chicago most that I came across cost waaaay more than the Holiday Inn. I was grateful when I found such reasonable prices considering the prices of the other hotels in the area. I was so excited to find that the hotel was exceptionally nice considering the price which makes it a no brainer as to where we will stay any time we visit Chicago! We had a nice view of the city and the river below, our room was spacious, clean, and the bed and pillows were sooo comfortable! Being attached to the Merchandise Mart was great because we could walk to coffee shops without having to go outside, and being able to walk to the metro through the Merchandise Mart was great! A few blocks away is Lou Malnati's which has great deep dish pizza and on the bottom floor of the Merchandise Mart I really liked the blueberry muffin I had at Au Bon Pain. I am very happy with my experience and am grateful that I saved hundreds of dollars by staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient...”
Reviews.Author: kanekev2
Reviews.Content: The rate was good for what is one of the busiest trade show weeks. Very cordial service at check-in and check-out. I left my toiletry bag and it was sent to me after I contacted housekeeping via UPS later that week. All items were intact. I used the gym and it was quiet and cool. Nice view of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Very Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Juanakin
Reviews.Content: We were glad that we made a decision to stay at Holiday Inn Chicago during our first visit to Chicago. The best thing about the hotel was the location and the dining service that they provide. Inside Holiday Inn, there are Italiacia and Cityscape bar and both of the dining service were very good. It was also very nice that we could order dinner from Italiacia and we could dine in Cityscape bar where we could see the beautiful sights of the downtown Chicago. The bed was very comfortable and the amenities were also nice that the shampoo and conditioner that they provided had good smell. The only problem that I had was the front desk misheard my request in regard to the change of my schedule and accidentally shortened the amount of nights that we were supposed to stay. The price was very good and well adjusted and I hope they continue to do so in the future as well. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who's visiting downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money, great location”
Reviews.Author: piotrwasil
Reviews.Content: I like the location of the hotel, it has a great views from the room. Note, that hotel is in upper stairs in the building. Rooms are big, very clean. The only problem I had is too loud air-conditioner. Sometimes I had issues to sleep during jet-lag. Free and fast wi-fi in the room. I always take king-bed with big choice of pillows - nice thing :-). Unfortunately, like in many US hotels, breakfast is not included in the price. There's ala carte and buffet choice downstairs in restaurant. I used restaurant only once and food was good (fish), they also have a bar. Overal, I can definitely recommend this hotel. If you book in advance, you can have it in a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Very inconvenient location.. cheap rooms.. noisy.. dated bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: asforhim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is advertised as being in the Magnificent Mile area of Chicago, but in reality it's in the River North area of Chicago. Unless you're in Chicago to go the the merchandise mart, avoid this hotel. You must cab everywhere. The mag mile is 6-8 blocks away and the loop is 8-10 blocks. The rooms are OK, but the bathrooms are very dated with stained tile, no vanity and bathtubs that look like they've been there since the 30's. The rooms are also quite noisy with thin walls and dated air/heat. The air/heat is something you would see in a motel 6. In summary, this hotel is not anywhere near the attractions of Chicago, too noisy and too cheap/dated.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable in good location with nice view”
Reviews.Author: BarefootAbbey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife while on business. The hotel is located on the top floors of an office building. Its a short walk to the Loop and Michigan Avenue. We had a nice room with a great view north and east. We ordered room service for breakfast one day: delivery was on time and food was warm and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: kittyirvine
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel late october - it was brilliant - location (overlooking the river, convenient for loads of restaurants and next to the gym obama uses!) was first class and the view from our room on the 23rd floor was exceptional. The staff, especially the concierge, were extremely helpful and accomodating. The room was clean and beds very comfortable. A problem with our bath plug was fixed within 5 minutes of us reporting it so that was very impressive! I hope to be back there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: JerryVenice
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location in downtown Chicago. It is a modern hotel. Rooms are big and clean, and some of them have a very nice view over the town. Internet connection is available for free. I don't suggest to have breakfast in the hotel since it is rather good but too expensive for that quality (a Starbucks is just a couple of minutes from the hotel). Rooms are very noisy: you can hear everything happens in the other rooms near yours, and you can also hear what happens in the main entrance hall (when I was there, there was a wedding party downstairs, and I could hear lot of noise till late night). The service is not very warm.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly overpriced and NOISY”
Reviews.Author: MicKel09
Reviews.Content: The location and cleanliness of the rooms were satisfactory at this hotel; however, it was ridiculously priced and incredibly noisy. The hotel has a very open floor plan so that rooms are positioned above the lobby/bar area. There were at least 2 weddings on the Saturday we stayed there and we could hear every whoop and holler in the room until at least 2 am. Even worse, we could hear our next door neighbor blow his nose. Yuck. I am sure there are much nicer places to stay in Chicago. It would do in a pinch but I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: rland
Reviews.Content: We wanted to take a trip to Chicago over my son's fall break, but didn't want to break the bank. Since we were traveling with 2 small children, we wanted to be downtown close to everything. We threw in a price to Priceline and it was accepted by the Holiday Inn Mart Plaza. I couldn't have been happier with out stay. The hotel was very clean, our room was spacious, service was fantastic, and the location was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and right on the L”
Reviews.Author: mirgirl
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Mart Plaza is connected to Merchandise Mart, which is and incredible place. But more importantly, since it is on the L it was easy to get to and from the airport and around town. It is a long walk from major shopping and dining, but if it is a nice day the walk is manageable. It is a short cab ride otherwise. The views are great, both in the rooms and from the hotel bar. The hotel staff seemed competent and all the important pieces were there. Our extended family stayed here for a wedding and a good time was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobinandMatt
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The rooms were beautiful and very clean. The location was great and the views were fantastic! The only downsides were that the pool was cold, although it was in good shape. Also, the parking was expensive ($35/day---I think this is pretty standard though at most hotels in this area) and the business centre cost money to use. All in all though we would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Came with low expectations and left more than happy!”
Reviews.Author: myvoicecarries
Reviews.Content: I booked the Holiday Inn Mart Plaza through Hotwire.com for about $100 USD a night. I definitely don't view a hotel as 'just a place to sleep in' - especially durng a multi-day stay. Both my bf and I really enjoy nice rooms with great views, so when Hotwire revealed to me that I had received the Holiday Inn Mart Plaza, my heart sank a little. It had been a long time since I stayed at a Holiday Inn and I was not looking forward to a potentially low-quality hotel experience. After I had reviewed the room choices on the website I phoned well ahead of our arrival date and spoke with a front desk associate. She was very friendly and was more than happy to offer us payable upgrade to a 'Executive King Suite' for an extra $50 USD a night. It was WELL worth it. I absolutely recommed upgrading any time you book through a third party website. We arrived extremely late on our first night because we had to go after our 5pm work day was over. Fortunately the streets were basically deserted so driving in the city was effortless. The Mart Plaza is very conveniently located close to the highway turn off, I feel like I only had to make three or four turns in the city before I was there. The self-parking was easy. The lot had survallance cameras and I was able to get a spot right under a lightpost so I felt more than comfortable leaving my car out in public. Check in was quick (though it was after 1am by the time we got there so there was obviously not going to be a lot of other travellers). The lobby is nice, but I've certainly seen better. Still, for being a renovated part of a office building - they did a pretty decent job. Our room furniture-wise was nothing to run home about, but the amount of space was fantastic. We had a desk, flat screen television, a small two person dining table, a couch, coffee table, and a king size bed. What really made our stay was the absolutely divine view. Truly gorgeous. We had a panoramic view (the room was at the corner of the building) of the city and it honestly took our breath away no matter what time of day it was. I also REALLY appreciated the free internet! Not enough hotels in Canada offer that! Our only complaint would have been the concierge. He didn't really seem to take my bf or I seriously. At one point his directions sent us 20 minutes away from where we needed to be. It completely ruined one full days agenda which was obviously disappointing. My goodness though, Chicago may be called the 'second city' but it's second to none. So much to see and do. My bf and I actually ran out of time. There was so much we could have still seen and done. We didn't even get time to shop which is very unlike us. We were too busy with the trolly tours, boat tours, museums, parks, fountains, Navy Pier. We had a fantastic time and our wonderfully situated room at the Mart Plaza really complimented the stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is willing to upgrade to an executive king suite - the view is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, good location”
Reviews.Author: liveforsun99
Reviews.Content: My stay was only one night, this is a good location next to the Merchandise Mart, that has the CTA train station. Also has good restaurants in walking distance like, Gino's pizza, Portillo's. I only use a select few hotels in the downtown area, I just pick the one that is cheapest for the dates I'm staying, and this one comes up a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, WONDERFUL view, but no breakfast :(”
Reviews.Author: ninja_starr
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very clean and it was nice having a choice of firmness on the pillows. The sheets were clean and the bedspread was very comfy! Some of the wallpaper was coming off in the bathroom and the cover on the back of the shower head wasn't secured to the wall. The view of the river and city was very nice! The stairs from the parking lot to the entrance sucked! The bell hop did offer to take our luggage when we first got there and asked where to park, but dumbly I said no :P SAY YES! The whole having to take two elevators to the room wasn't a big deal at all. It's close to the bus, but it wasn't a very good option. We ended up walking most of it, which sucked, but we saved lots of money in the end. It is a good 15 minute walk from Michigan Ave., which was ok for us. The staff were very friendly. We didn't have the maid come any day we were there, so I can't comment on that. The towels were nice and clean (very important!) The room was small (two double beds), but we weren't in there most of the time, so it was ok. Nice big tv! No safe, which was unfortunate. Also the parking is very expensive in my opinion, $34/day. I do realize there are in/out privileges, but honestly we never did because it's easier to take other forms of transportation downtown. Overall I really enjoyed my stay and had no big issues with the room or the staff. I would rather be closer to Michigan Ave., but I will likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you have business to do in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: saramfuller
Reviews.Content: I had several meetings that took place in The Loop and wanted a location that was within walking distance. This fit the bill perfectly and at a reasonable cost. Rooms were well maintained. Pool was good enough. Staff was helpful. If you want to be near the lake, go somewhere else. also, best tthe restaurant is nothing special Got a 5% rebate, info available at www.rebategal.com If the cubs are in town, make sure you hit Wrigley, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and location but not much else”
Reviews.Author: uki_guy
Reviews.Content: Typical Holiday Inn in a major city - expensive parking, OK service, and not very efficient. Check-in takes a bit longer than expected at a chain hotel. Lobby is on the 15th floor of the Chicago Sun Times building. Would stay there again based on our corporate rate negotiation but when staying on the river, in downtown Chicago, you can expect to pay north of $100 or even $150 for anything average. The crappy reviews are simply unrealistic - considering the cost of living, this is a well priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's the View”
Reviews.Author: ALASKA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my daughter for a combined business/personal getaway. Rates were hight due to Chicago airshow but we selected hotel for its view rooms. This hotel has a very convenient location to just about everything... it's not only connected to the Merchandise Mart and the Brown line train station, it's an easy walk across the river to the Clark/Lake transit point and there is always a taxi stand in front of the hotel... or you can walk which my family always enjoys in Chicago. Arrving in Chicago you can walk from the Amtrak station, take a taxi or from the airports take the L train to Clark/Lake and walk over from there, or transfer to the Brown line and do hardly any walking at all. In inclement weather this is a nice option. Now on to the hotel itself. The hotel occupies the higher floors of the MM so once there, take the lobby elevators to the 15th floor for checkin. Employees at front desk have always seemed friendly and professional to me. The view: I do have an issue with the random treatment when it comes to booking a "room with a view." I have received nicer views when booking through an opaque site than when booking the hotel direct; I guess it all depends on availability. But it can be frustrating if you select this hotel for the view. The rooms are clean and comfortable, with the upgraded HI bedding you will get a very restful night's sleep before your big day, whatever that might involve. Internet at the business center starts at 5$ for 15 minutes; did not try the wireless. Pool and gym area are nicely maintained and the pool was especially refreshing on a hot summer day. The onsite restaruant has excellent food, ambience and service, with a "kids eat free" bonus but you have to remember to stop at the checkin desk before (or after) the meal to get the coupon. Not sure why they don't just offer this at checkin. The hotel is connected via walkway to the Merchandise Mart which has a food court including Dunkin Donuts, McD's, Arbys, and other chains that can be helpful for getting a quick and inexpensive meal so you can splurge on another meal at the hotel or elsewhere in the Windy City. also a Starbucks. But there are so many dining and shopping options within walking distance it will be your typical Chicago getaway, just trying to decide where to go. All in all this was a nice hotel to come back to in the evening, especially when my daughter saw lighting strikes over the Chicago river. We ducked inside the entrance of the MM and walked all the way inside to get back to the hotel, then watched the storm and heavy rains all evening from the comfort of our room. I am sure we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Service at its worst...”
Reviews.Author: gillart99
Reviews.Content: Starting with the check-in experience, the staff here treated me as if they were doing me a HUGE favor by allowing me to stay with them. The hotel is not convenient nor cheap and not worth the good location. And if you are a Priority Club Gold or Platinum member, don't expect any special treatment at all. Overall a disheartening and rude experience - with a great view. I followed up my stay by communicating my frustrations with the manager, who basically told me that she had other guests to attend to and that if I didn't like it, to not come back. I guess I won't. Service at its worst.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location???”
Reviews.Author: stlsta
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great location to the major attractions downtown. However, it was not worth sleeping there. The bed I slept on was so hard and squeaky!! I did like that they had complimentary toothpaste, shampoo, and razors if you needed them. The view from the room was spectacular of the Chicago skyline! There was a beautiful lobby entrance waterfall. So if you don't mind sleeping in a crappy bed-then stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location for family, but probably good for a business trip.”
Reviews.Author: allenpartyof4
Reviews.Content: Should have went with a 4 star ON the mag mile. Just because a place says it is by Michigan Ave does not mean it is. The hotel is so far from everything that the transportation to and from the hotel would have been saved if we would have stayed closer to the Mag Mile. A very business oriented hotel. I did not know what hotel I was getting b/c I booked through a 3rd party and was reminded of that several times throughout my stay. The concierge was wonderful. He was very helpful multiple times and very friendly. People who were around me that did not book 3rd party (hotwire) were more upset than me at service and location b/c they had paid a larger price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: djnToronto
Reviews.Content: This is a clean and comfortable hotel. Chicago is a great city for walking, so we certainly did not mind the distance to attractions. Otherwise, there is indoor access to the El.. Because it is located on top of the Chicago Sun-Times building, it is very quiet. I don't think i would pay the premium for rooms with the city view again. The lounge has great views. On the negative side, I would echo other comments regarding the internet connection - it was incredibly slow. If you are on business or otherwise need internet access, this could be a real problem, Water in the pool was surprisingly and uncomfortably cold. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: jsctraveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I thoroughly enjoyed staying at the Holiday Inn near the Merchandise Mart. It's easy to access from the main highways coming into Chicago and via public transportation. I was a little nervous about accessing the hotel because of one reviewer's comments about the hotel being on the top of an office building, but the building is located on its own side street, so it was no problem. (The hotel sits on top of the Sun-Times building.) Bellmen were stationed on street level all the time and were very helpful. Paid $169 plus tax and outdoor parking in their lot was included. (No problems with theft or vandalism.) We thought this was a decent deal, although we see that others here paid far less--oh, well. The room was clean, although it looked like the carpet might need to be replaced in the next six months or so. Quiet, comfortable, safe; decent indoor pool with towels (had to call one night to get them to bring more, which they did). I don't understand the complaints of reviewers who comment about the walk to sites in Chicago--the L is connected to the Merchandise Mart which is connected to the hotel. We didn't have any problems. Didn't eat at the hotel. Beautiful view of the city from the bar.

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION IN TOWN”
Reviews.Author: OSCALGOR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a hotel to stay in chicago for a week since there are to many options and we were surpised when we found this place so well located so nice and so not expensive, we thougth whats the catch? We booked there any way and our surprised was bigger when we discoverd that this place is really well located (between down town and mid town) facing the river, walking distance to the lake and the magnificent mile (for thouse who enjoy walking) lots of restaurants nearby and the best, is that you do not even have to go out side the building to get the subway station(in case is snowing or raining). The rooms are nice decorated, comfortables and very cleans. The hotel staff is helpfull and friendly. The food is not the best but by all means go out tho have lunch and dinner since Chicago has to many good options. There is a bar with the river view and the drinks are not expensive. We definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with our stay/room. Hotel was nice.”
Reviews.Author: YOFLO40
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Our room faced the river, it was a nice view, especially at night. Very spacious room with king bed and sofa with pull out bed. Clean rooms. Nothing extravagant, but I wasn't expecting it to be, all in all the hotel was nice. Free WIFI in room. I didn't eat there but the Cityscape bar was convenient to have a drink and visit with friends. The hotel lobby was spacious and open with lots of room to sit. I loved Luxehome connected to the hotel. You could catch the subway right from the 2nd floor.Shops in there were pretty cool, food court was good and Garretts (popcorn) was awesome! It was a lengthy walk to Navy Pier and MI AVE but it wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: PatrikItaly
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite ok for the price I paid. Just over 100$ per night. The bathroom was a bit old compared to the rest of the room. It is within walking distance to the main shopping and restaurant areas. Parking was not cheap. It is actually very difficult to find the hotel parking if you arrive without navigator.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy but noisy air-con and lousy location”
Reviews.Author: FatcatJunketeer
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and relatively modern, the bathroom was spotless and new which was nice. Beds are on the softer side but comfy. There's a small flat screen TV with a decent selection of channels. The air-con however is loud enough to keep you awake and looks to be a portable unit bolted to one side of the wall. The furntinure was basic as one would expect. Room service dinner was surprisingly good, right up there with top hotels in terms of quality and wasnt cheap either. Location wise its sits next to a conference centre of sorts with a handful of fast food outlets inside. Theres a convenience store downstairs which was great but it shuts pretty early. Taxis lined up outside at most hours of the day, but its a 15 min hike just to get to the main area of the magnificent mile and this gets pretty annoying after a day or so. Not a great location at all and its also pretty quite at night - but not in your room because the walls and insulation are pretty thin. At $160 a night it was pretty poor value for what is essentially basic (but clean and comfy)accomodation in a deceptively bad location.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Moby55
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the pros: - clean hotel, mostly great service from check-in desk, concierge, etc - very nice modern lobby, good dining options - walking distance to some restaurants & activities - nice view of river from most parts of hotel - usually a cab waiting out front - rooms were adequate & clean, good for the inexpensive price ( I think we paid about $80 per night). Could use a minifridge. - free high speed internet which was excellent Cons: - farther than 90% of 'Mag Mile' hotels to attractions. It was a good 20-minute walk to most things - which we didn't mind, but by day 4 (of 6) we were taking cabs frequently. And we are two fit people in our twenties. - We were in a room on the 16th floor (the first one above the lobby) which was great (I hate heights) until on the Sat night, there was a wedding below us. I happened to have food poisoning and was in the room, and there was very loud music & vibrations till about 1am. Not impressed. Called the front desk about 11pm and were told that not much could be done, the wedding would be over "soon." Couldn't be bothered to complain at check-out because I still was battling food poisoning and we had to catch the train home.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, convenient to Merchandise Mart”
Reviews.Author: KermitNC
Reviews.Content: General I stayed 5 nights at the Holiday Inn in mid-May for business meetings at the Merchandise Mart across the street. The hotel lobby was on the 15th floor. It had a nice open atrium, surrounded by sterile-looking corridors of rooms, overlooking the lobby, up to the 23rd floor. The lobby, hotel restaurant and cocktail bar were all very nice. Check in was seamless. Staff was polite but not overly friendly. I had an erroneous room service charge to my account but they promptly removed it at checkout. As with any other hotel in downtown Chicago, parking rate was very expensive ($37 a night). So walking, taxi or public transportation would be the best way to get around. There was a pool and pretty large exercise room. The pool was about 2/3 size of a lap pool. I did not try the onsite restaurant or bar, as there were lots of great places to eat within walking distance. Accommodation The room itself looked newly renovated and was fairly large. Furniture and decorations were very plain. Carpet and bathroom were clean. The bed and pillows were reasonably comfortable. There was very little noise. Plus the way my room was situated, I did not hear any street noise (e.g. police sirens), which is unusual for any downtown hotel. The room had a single-serving coffee maker. No mini-refrigerator, safe, or closet. The HDTV was a nice touch but no DVD player. No wired Internet access. Wireless Internet was free, but it was woefully inadequate in bandwidthâ€”after 6:30 am, forget trying to access the Internet the rest of the day, even to check email. Remember dialup? It was that bad. Summary The hotel was very convenient to Merchandise Mart, via an indoor connecting corridor, and that was why I stayed here. It was not near any tourist attractions, which may matter to some. At $150 a night, price was reasonable for Chicago. Nothing fancy. I gave it 3-stars for such awful Internet speed, keeping me from getting work done when I was not at my meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FOXCENT
Reviews.Content: We frequent this hotel pretty regularly within the last 3 years. I really love this hotel. The price is sometimes pricey, all the time pricey but I do not mind paying it (although my husband would prefer not to) but I always get my way. I have read that some people on this site have gotten a room for $50 on priceline that is hard to belive to me. I have never gotten a price for that cheap and I have tried priceline and other sites. The hotel lobby is very nice and serene. Tthe bathrooms have been remolded since my last stay in September and they are very nice, they have bath and body works products in the rooms which is a nice touch The location is very nice easy to get around and walk to places. The view is absolutely beautiful especially at night. CVS and Subway is right around the corner from the hotel. They also have restaurant that you can walk to call Merchandise Mart there is a food court there where you can eat as well. This time we walked everywhere and my legs were so sore but it was well worth the stay. Phyllis at the front desk is awesome she is so nice and friendly and helps you out however she can. We always go to the pool area but the water is a little too cold for my liking and I also feel that they should put a hot tub in to make your stay more pleasurable. The swiiming pool is a nice pool and it has see through roof so the sun shines in, but the water temperture is still to cold for me.. The inside of the pool area is warm, but not real hot to where you want to jump in a cold pool. We did eat at the restaurant for breakfast and the food is very good but it is very pricey. We saw the room service menu and it caters to Italisias which I think is the name of the restaurant but no common food items that you want at least not me. I would be looking for hamburgers, steaks etc and not on the menu diffferent items. Overall I love this hotel, and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn - Chicago”
Reviews.Author: lyso1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for over a week. The Hotel is very central and prize suitable. Excellent view of the Chicago river from hotel room. Clelaning not so good, cleaning ladies missed for 2 days that we lacked of new toilet paper! However, we would like to stay here once again next time we come to Chicago. Hope their cleaning improved!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: roadtripmamato2
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel offered at half price on the Holiday Inn website, so did not know what to expect, but boy where we impressed! Friendly, HELPFUL staff at check-in, good food at the restaurant, and good housekeeping. The room had obviously just been renovated, was very roomy and was just fantastic including the view! We are assuming the low rate was because the hotel is under renovation. We could not believe our luck and even ended up lounging around the room one day instead of touring Chicago. I should add we where on the top floor during the week. Found Chicago to be a clean friendly city and even had incredibly friendly transit staff, one came out of his booth to help us with our tickets with a smile that would never happen in Toronto!! When driving to the hotel look for the Chicago Sun Times building, the hotel occupies the top floors. Good on site parking and the hotel is very close to transit options, but we found we just walked everywhere. Thank you for adding to a fun girls getaway!

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: IndianaMedic
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I was able to stay at this hotel in the last 7 years. I was slightly disappointed this time around as it seemed that a few things weren't as nice as I had remembered. However, all in all it was still a nice stay. Staff seemed helpful and answered all of our questions and needs promptly. The room was pleasant, good tempature for the season, and clean. The pool was also fun and was a great end to a busy day out on the town. I would stay here again when I visit chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay and a fabulous deal”
Reviews.Author: Exhaling
Reviews.Content: I received this hotel deal through a Travelzoo promotion with the hotel. I paid $59/a night. The offer was for $15 parking which I did not use....and a upgrade to a view, a gorgeous view or the skyline and the river..a $25 food and beverage voucher for the first night which included room service and alcohol...and a buy one/get one free entree the next day which I did not used. I have never felt like things were so great that I owed the hotel money. Noteworthy things: The hotel gave me early checkin....and 2pm checkout for being a Priority Club member. To me the location was a great distance to where I wanted to go...Union Station, Magnificent Mile, and Chicago Cultural Center. The hotel is in Merchandise Mart and the lobby is on the 15th floor. So you have 2 elevator rides to reach the lobby. Room service above averages. I thought the prices were decent. Told me it would take 35 minutes and a knock was at the door at exactly 35 minutes. The spring rolls...yummy. The Italian KOBE burger and sides....extra yummy. It did not taste like a "free" meal and I tipped the server 50%. Room: Bath a little dated...I love the recycling options. I loved the soft vs firm pillow selections in the room. My room also has a sitting area. Very large area. Enough towels to keep me happy the entire stay. Quiet unless someone was outside the door. The not so great: The WIFI...blech..it kept going in and out, in and out, along with my phone reception. That was the only issue that I had. I will note that there were no offers to help with my baggage although I was flirted with...I had no problem but the offer would have been nice. Front Desk provided EXCEPTIONAL service.

Reviews.Title: “good bargain”
Reviews.Author: greenbackpack33
Reviews.Content: for what i paid, which was about the same you would pay for a 3-star lodging, it was a good bargain. the room was spacious, clean, well furnished with flat screen tv, a sofa, a table, a desk, quite a lot of lighting fixtures, mirrors, and a closet among many other things. the front desk staff were courteous and pleasant, my check-in and -out were smooth and quick. the room was very clean, with toiletries, fresh towels, great beds and linens, etc. my only complaint about this location is that the hotel lobby is located on the 15th floor. its suites are then accessible via its separate elevators, from rest of the building, so basically, from street level, you have to take 2 elevators to get to your room. other than that, it is well worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised with the quality, service and value.”
Reviews.Author: herold1961
Reviews.Content: Great location! The on site restaurant has good food and with large portions. Extremely comfortable beds, easy parking, nice bar, great views......nothing bad about this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Average Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: terrae01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and found the rooms to be clean, comfortable and average. The lobby area looks as if it has been remodeled recently and is quite well decorated in a modern and stylish way. This made the duct tape holding the carpet together on the upper floors a bit disappointing. We got a great deal on Priceline that made this hotel worth it, but I don't think I would be happy had we paid the regular room rate. Also disappointing, or downright horrendous, is the lighting in the bathroom. Ladies, don't expect to get out of there with high self esteem or with being able to do your makeup properly. The location is great - close to everything that you want to be near in Chicago. There is a bar off of the lobby that has amazing views of the river and skyline. Prices are not too horrible actually ($25 for a bottle of wine). Definitely recommend having a drink there in the evening but make sure you leave extra time, we had to wait for a table. If you can get a deal, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, but average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MadisonDuo
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Price Line (about $75/night for Friday and Saturday nights, taxes included), but if we had paid full price we wouldn't have been as satisfied. The great things about the hotel included location, quietness, cleanliness, and free internet. The biggest con was the bathroom, which was small and outdated with lighting that would make Cindy Crawford look like Frankenstein -- yuck! Other than that, we were happy with it. Also, the hotel has a fabulous bar/restaurant with an amazing view of the skyline and river. I highly recommend stopping in for a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Business”
Reviews.Author: esther7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, rooms are excellent and the staff is polite, but if you want excellent internet service to work, this is not the hotel for you. The hotel's free wi fi is provided by Lodgenet. It is worse than dialup and drops constantly. Definitely not for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “I Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaryD13
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Very Elegant!! Was convienient to major attractions as well. Would definately stay here again. Near the Navy Pier. Merchandise Mart. connected to the Chicago Institute of Arts. Restaruants inside the hotel. Just an overall GREAT stay with Great views of the city!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great river views”
Reviews.Author: Milwaukee_Hotel
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much from the hotel, but was surprised by the hotel and the views my room gave me. The hotel had very convenient parking onsite, and the room was spacious and clean. The only thing about the hotel I didn't like was the location, there simply were very few restaurants open late in the immediate area. Aside from having a tough time with dinner, the hotel was great and I would stay there again if I had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel but a few little suggestions....”
Reviews.Author: dellsfun
Reviews.Content: We are in our room at the Holiday Inn Chicago - Mart Plaza right now. Very nice room; queen beds would be preferred to the double beds that we have since there is plenty of room to increase the bed sizes. Love the fact they use Bath and Body Works soap, lotion and shampoos! Free wi-fi is nice; parking is $34 but you can get it cheaper through a room deal. We booked our room online through the Holiday Inn website but think we could have gotten a much better deal through hotwire, priceline, etc. as it is not busy on a Sunday night. We have our 12 and 8 year olds with us and they are amazed at the view from our room on the top floor. They were looking forward to swimming until 11 pm however, after spending 5 minutes in the indoor pool, they wanted to get out. Too cold. Also do not understand why a hotel of this size does not have a public hot tub. I will say that it was difficult finding the hotel despite having directions from the hotel and google maps. There are not a lot of signs downtown to mark any of the hotels; we needed to call the hotel for specific directions after driving around for 1/2 hour trying to find it. (It is in the same building as the Chicago Sun Times and Art Institute and to the West of a huge building called the Luxe). There is a very faint green Holiday Inn sign at the top of the building. It would have also been helpful if the reservationist would have told us about parking when arriving at the hotel. As others have mentioned, the check-in desk is on the 15th floor of the building, so you need to pass the front entrance and proceed to the parking area, then walk up 3 flights of steps, with your luggage, to get to the building. I believe that you can pull up to the front of the building to unload baggage but we weren't sure. The view when you get to the top of the steps though - priceless!! We are very pleased with the cleanliness and comfort of the room. Would definitely recommend but if you have kids that want to swim, they will be disappointed. Also wouldn't buy breakfast onsite - a bagel and cream cheese $5.00. Ouch! Overall, a great experience for us and we would definitely return for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for the size of the rooms”
Reviews.Author: tomfish401
Reviews.Content: Me and some friends stayed here for a couple of days, we just went to chicago to bar hop for two days. The hotel is located in a good spot and i think the foodcourt on the other side of the crosswalk is an excellent idea. The rooms are very small for the price that you pay to stay there and the hotel bar is very pricey for the weak drinks that you get. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place in the heart of chicago”
Reviews.Author: MONK09
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Proximity to many things, including good restaurants Indian food also available near by rooms ok. Service no great

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: siana506
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Chicago (Mart Plaza) with some friends in a double room. The room was a tad bit pricey but since three of us were paying it didn't matter. It's located right next door to an El stop and the views of the river and downtown Chicago were GORGEOUS. We fell asleep looking at the Sears Tower. The room was very clean and the service was excellent. The concierges on duty was extremely helpful giving us directions and tips when we needed them. One concierge gave us an entire itinerary for a night in Boystown (a great bistro and then some great clubs to go to). I highly recommend it if you can afford it or if you are splitting the cost with someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Sun times building, good view”
Reviews.Author: Frederick24
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 days including weekends. It was located right next to Chicago river, right next to the Merchandise mart. 1. location. Near North. I had little hard time finding the building entrance at night, the door connecting through the m-mart was closed, so I had to drag my bags and walk around the building. After then, I enjoyed walking down the street and looking at the boats. Once you cross the bridge, you can walk to the Chicago theater, ABC 7, department stores, borders bookstore and coffee shops. I had to use UPS and FEDEX service, they were very close and friendly. 2. hotel. It was just average. the room was clean and the view was great looking down the river. but the overall facilities were average. 3. restaurant. I had dinner at the restaurant ordered the soba noodle salad and lobster main dish. but the noodle was overcooked, salad was right from a package, and the lobster was okay but not impressed with the risotto.

Reviews.Title: “Quite pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: rockyhunter
Reviews.Content: We expected a very affordable place to stay for a weekend trip to Chicago and not much else. The Holiday Inn Mart Plaza was definitely an affordable place to stay - but it way a lot more than that too. The hotel overlooks the river. Our room had a great river view. It's also centrally located - and there's an El stop accessible directly through the convention center which is connected. I'd definitely stay here again. The hotel also comes with free wifi, which is great for connected travelers like us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: droc718
Reviews.Content: Amazing views of the city, reasonable price, centrally located, great staff, nice rooms, located in the center of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Something extra”
Reviews.Author: HenrikS3
Reviews.Content: Great quality, Very nice design, Expensive breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Planner73
Reviews.Content: I used my Priority Points for part of the stay. While I was surprised that the hotel was in a highrise over an office building, it was a very nice hotel and a great room. Great views of the city and river and easy walking distance to many sites. The buffet breakfast was included in my rate, so you couldn't beat that (good buffet). The staff was very friendly and helpful. I had free wireless in the room. We took the L in from the airport--the orange line stop is about a 15-20 minute walk (across the river), but a good savings over a cab drive to the airport if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view - overall good hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: donnafreem
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in this hotel on 18th floor (Thurs-Sun), connected by pedway to Merchandise Mart. Also CTA train station located in the mart. Long walk from hotel but still good. Please note, all closed on Sunday, must enter from outside and down the street. Good mid city location. Registration staff we encountered not especially helpful or friendly but concierge Christopher AND Robert were exceptional. Was not given the $20 complimentary voucher from breakfast for each day as was stated in my Expedia purchase info. Hotel staff totally refused to honor my request, even though I paid a LOT for this room and they admitted they had such an offer. View was fabulous. Room clean. Heating/air worked great. Minimal noise could be heard from rooms around us but the cleaning staff VERY loud outside our room for an extended period as they prepared each morning to clean rooms. Bathroom did not have heat lamp or fan. No counter/mirror area outside of bathroom so very difficult for two or more people to get ready at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, exceptional deal”
Reviews.Author: jesseh627
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location this past weekend and had a great time. The facility has been recently upgraded, we used out Priority club points and the staff booked us in a Master King Suite on the corner over looking the downtown area and river, WHAT A VIEW!! Full glass windows to the south and east, cool during the day and beautiful at night. Room was great, staff was friendly, Christopher the concierge was perfect with suggestions and a huge help. Way to deliver Holiday INN!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: Kelli A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we were on a weekend getaway. Had a spectacular view of the skyline and river. We were on the 22nd floor and had a corner suite so had views all around. Staff was friendly and helpful. Had a couple drinks at the Skyline Bar and it also has great views of Chicago skyline exceptionally beautiful at night. Prices in the bar were actually a little cheaper than some of the bars we went to. $9 for a martini is not that terribly bad. I would recommend the Snicker martini! Overall, had a great weekend and got to see a lot of the city and what it has to offer. P.S. We also got engaged this weekend on top of the Sears Tower!

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: heidigoseek
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the view and the room. The wireless internet signal is weak in some places, but I eventually got it working (it could be better). There is a nice lounge/bar in the hotel, and it's within walking distance of several shops and places to eat. It's easy to get to a train from the Merchandise Mart by way of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great price & great location plus a great view!!”
Reviews.Author: happycamper99Indiana
Reviews.Content: We booked over the phone after looking at pictures online. Never been to Chicago before and didn't know what to expect. We booked directly with the Hotel and got a great price because mom is a senior citizen. Staff was friendly and efficent. They even loaned us a wheelchair for mom! The view over the river was amazing! Taxis were always close at hand and we were close to just about everything we wanted to do. VERY PLEASED with this place and would stay again. Rooms are basic and double beds were smallish (full sized) but we weren't in them long! :) Tolietries were great, Bath and Body works brand. They had a nice bar in the Hotel too. Restuarant as well.

Reviews.Title: “inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: jayhawk6
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel in August. When we pulled up in front of the "hotel", we realized we were pulling up in front of an office building. The hotel starts on the 14th floor. So...if you want to run in and check in but leave older teenagers in the car until you get a room key...impossible to do. The option to unload luggage at the front door is fine IF you feel comfortable leaving a family member with it while you park in the lot and then walk up 2 flights of stairs, or you can park and drag your luggage up the steps yourself (which is what we did), then take the elevator to the 14th floor to the hotel, then take a different elevator to your room, or you can park all the way at the bottom of the garage and take a hallway to an elevator (handicapped route) which I chose not to do because of the time of night we arrived. All this to say that it was just very inconvenient. The pluses were: The front desk staff, and information desk people were very friendly, and the view from our room was fantastic. Our room was just O.K, cleanish, but we had to call maintenance since our toilet wouldn't flush. Evidentally someone before us had flushed a bar of soap. The restaurant that we went to was a bad experience. As the waiter was putting my child's plate down, half the food slid off onto the table. The waiter acted as if nothing had happened, did not offer to get a new meal, did not appologize, nothing. I should have asked for a replacement, but it was very late, we'd been driving for 16 hours, and so my son just ate the food that hadn't fallen off. After we paid, and walked away, and I guess after discovering that I hadn't tipped him, the waiter began yelling and cussing that this was 'the second time...." This was actually a bit scary especially to my children. This hotel is NOT conveniently located to anything touristy. I think a lot of business people stay here because of it's location to the Plaza mart or whatever it is called. However, there are taxis that line up in front of the building, so not difficult to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay. Bland Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Coronel72
Reviews.Content: I must admit this was not my 1st choice. Unfortunately, when you use the "name your own price" option on Priceline, you do not know where you're staying until after they accept your bid. I am accustomed to having breakfast included as well as a business center where you can access the internet for free (For example Hampton Inn), but that was not the case here. I refused to pay the exorbitant prices at the restaurant. The fitness room was OK. The location was also good, as I was able to walk everywhere. The bathtub in my room was peeling. If I had not waited until the last moment to book a hotel room, I probably would have stayed elsewhere. If you cannot find a room at another hotel, then you can try this place. Otherwise you might do better somewhere else. Overall, it was OK, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view!”
Reviews.Author: bonnray1
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the view. It sits on TOP of the Chicago Sun Times building, with the huge lobby on the 15th floor. Our room was on the 23rd floor overlooking the Chicago river & everything on it ~ Breathtaking! I feel bad for the reviewer who said she had a view of a wall ~ that WOULD be awful! The beautiful Merchandise Mart was next door by way of a pedestian walkway, as was the train station, which was SO convenient for us! The room was lovely & clean with comfy beds (most important!) We were also able to take advantage of the view from the CityScape bar on the lobby level, complete with free appetizers! My only complaint would be the VERY EXPENSIVE breakfast menu in the hotel's restaurant ($14 for french toast(!) & $2.50 for a cup of coffee) I believe it was the same as the room service menu in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Value”
Reviews.Author: GRScott
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were going to Chicago to see Jersey Boys and needed a hotel for one Saturday night. The Holiday Inn Chicago Mart Plaza was a great choice. It was a great location, near the theatre and with awesome views of the river and the city. The hotel was very clean, obviously recently renovated, and had a very helpful and friendly staff. We also got a great price on Hotwire. Parking is not cheap ($31/night) but that is hardly unusual in Chicago. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: joshmom03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Chicago - Mart Plaza for two nights at the end of June 2009. It was a little bit nicer than the typical Holiday Inn, especially the lobby. The room was a little small, but fine for 3. The entire hotel was very clean. The beds were okay, but the pillows were great, and we got a "pillow menu" in case we needed different types of pillows. The hotel occupies the top 9 floors above the Chicago Sun Times building, and we were on the 21st floor. We were on the back side of the hotel and had a great view of the Hancock tower just to our right. The service we received in this hotel was wonderful. James checked us in and he couldn't be nicer. The concierge (Robert? Richard?) was so welcoming. He answered all of our questions and had information about how to get places, what to see and where to eat (we never made it to the restaurants he recommended, though, as there was a McDonald's on almost every block and my husband is not very adventurous when it comes to food). I did not use the exercise room, but it looked well-appointed. The pool was a little bit chilly, but not too bad. The hotel is in a great location. We had a 15 minute walk to Michigan Ave. in one direction and a 15 minute walk from the Sears (Willis) tower in another. We walked almost everywhere (we took a water taxi a few times), and didn't fear for our safety (except from the crazy cab drivers that were EVERYWHERE). The hotel is right next to the Merchandise Mart which has a lot of very high end home decorating shops and some restaurants and snack shops. Parking was $31 a night and although we didn't check in until 5 on Tuesday, we were able to leave the car there for a full 48 hours, which allowed us to do some sight seeing for a few hours after we checked out on Wednesday (Wendella offers a great architectural boat tour). We are priority/preffered members (free to join), so we got a coupon at check-in that gave us the choice of 15% off a meal at the restaurant or $5 a day off of parking. We chose the $$ off of parking. The only negative thoughts I have about this hotel were 1) it seemed rather small for the price, but I guess that's to be expected in a large city such as Chicago, 2) the hotel restaurant was a bit pricey ($11.95 for a continental breakfast???), and 3) the water temperature in the shower fluctuated so much that I spent more time adjusting the temp than I did actually showering. I will stay at this hotel again the next time we visit Chicago. Instead of driving, though, I would find a cheap flight. That way we would avoid having to pay to park, and having to drive in city traffic or on any of the freeways near the city. The cabs are so plentiful, and the public transportation there is so great, you wouldn't need a car at all!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful renovation, awesome location- would stay again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysPlanning21
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with our stay and will definitely return on other trips. The hotel has incredibly helpful staff, from the doorman to the concierge to the manager! We were in a newly renovated "room with a view" on the 23rd floor and I was very impressed. There is an overall modern & hip feeling our room as well as the hotel's lobby & restaurant areas. The bathroom & room updates have been done very well. The shower was a generous size and there was nice storage in the sink/vanity area. The room was HUGE! We had 2 double beds and ample room for a desk and an armchair with an ottoman. We had 4 people in the room and did not feel uncomfortable in the least. The beds & linens were clean, inviting and comfortable. I can't vouch for rooms that have not been renovated yet though so if you are booking, I highly recommend asking for an updated room. My only issues with the entire stay were: -very chilly pool temperature -reaching the hotel lobby required you to walk through the building lobby and then take an elevator to the 15th floor which was awkward when laden down with luggage and tired kids -if you chose to park your car and handle your luggage yourself, there were many many stairs to climb to reach the building lobby from the parking lot In the grand scheme of things, my issues were negligible. Very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “You're paying for location and a clean room.”
Reviews.Author: ProfessionalTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is floor 14-24 of the Sun-Times building. You have to take an elevator to floor 15 to the hotel lobby, and then go through the lobby to get on another elevator to get to your hotel room. Youâ€™ll get your fair share of exercise here. They have porters and concierge service. The lobby is new and has kind of an Asian flare. The restaurant, bar and lobby are all together on the same floor, and have an â€œopen airâ€� type forum, which makes for good people watching. The bar has an amazing view of the city, and outside of daily â€œspecialsâ€�, you pay for it. The servers, and wait staff were exceptional. Our room was small but not stuffy. Our view was excellent, as we were upgraded for being Priority Club members, upon request. Be sure to ask for a room with a view, as some rooms have no view. Our room was outdated but clean. No funny smells, no rust stains, no torn carpet, etc. The only downsides were no vent in the restroom, and no mini-fridge. Some of the other rooms have been updated with modern furnishing and flat panel TVâ€™s, etc. Amenities included soap, shampoo/conditioner, lotion, coffee, tea bags (only on the first day, no more for 4 more days). Housekeeping was spotty, and they forgot to replace our amenities half of our stay. Room service is offered (costly), but many of the local restaurants deliver. Your food options are limited after 9pm as you are in the business district. There is a nice deli on the ground floor of the building that makes fresh sandwiches, salads, soups, and also sells sundry goods, but they close around 8pm or earlier. The building next door (Luxe Home, known as the â€œMart Plaza Buildingâ€�) has a McDonaldâ€™s, Au bon Pain, Garrettâ€™s Popcorn, and another restaurant on the second floor, not sure of their hours. There is a literal hole-in-the-wall Chinese restaurant about 3 blocks away called â€œEat, Drinkâ€�, they have virtually no place to sit, but they sell good cheap Chinese food, and they deliver too. We walked outside after dark every night and never felt unsafe. We walked as many as 7 blocks in every direction and didnâ€™t feel uneasy at all. Most of downtown is well-lit, but Iâ€™d avoid any â€œdark lookingâ€� areas just to be safe. Simply put, the larger the group you have, the safer you are. In conclusion, this hotel would rent for $65/night if it was in Louisville, but because itâ€™s in downtown Chicago, itâ€™s about $200/night. Youâ€™re paying for a clean room, spotty housekeeping and an awesome location.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: LibrarianHugh
Reviews.Content: Better view than described. Easy to get to. Great courteous service throughout hotel. Bar has excellent city views. Restaurant unusual oriental-Italian fusion theme. Ease of access to Merchandise Mart shops, food court and CTA station. Would love to stay here on my next visit to Chi'town.

Reviews.Title: “Chic design, great location, great views, it's a Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Precocious
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here on business trip. I have to say, this hotel has a really cool design and is located in the heart of everything in Chicago. It only took me 10 minutes to walk to the Sears Tower (which is now called the Willis Tower, in case you didn't know) and I would guess about 2 miles to Lake Michigan. (If you are in Chicago , do not miss the Buckingham Fountains. Quite a sight to behold with the skyscrapers in the background). It's hard to believe that it is a Holiday Inn in one of the most beautiful city in the US. The service was quite friendly from bellhop to front desk to restaurant staff. The coolest thing about this hotel is that the lobby is on the 15th floor. The CityScape Bar has magnificent views of the city and the modern design ItaliAsia restaurant whose asian/italian fusion menu I really enjoyed. I highly recommend this to anyone who will be in Chicago for business or leisure (shopping or sightseeing). Magnificent mile was within walking distance. I felt secure exploring the city and walking back to the hotel at 8pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great views - it's a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: TravelingShepherd
Reviews.Content: The rooms were rooms, the view was fabulous and the restuarant was a hotel restuarant. It wasn't the Ritz, but it was very nice. It's in the Chicago Sun Time's Building, across from the merchandise mart. A ways away from the hustle and bustle of Chicago, but it gave us some exercise. There is a McDonalds and Duncan Donuts in the merchandise mart, if you don't want to pay big bucks for just a muffin for breakfast. The staff was great, rooms were clean and housekeeping was usually early (only one day when I returned to the room at 4pm and it wasn't clean).

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have had a nicer time. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: pxlchk1
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have had a nicer time at the Holiday Inn Chicago Mart Plaza. My husband, daughter, and I live in Chicago but stayed there for the weekend of our wedding anniversary just to be closer to the downtown attractions and play tourist in our own town. The staff was SO sweet and so very friendly. --As nice as any of the 4 star hotels I've stayed in. I just can't stress that enough. --Just lovely people. The rooms are nice, very clean, decently appointed but nothing too fancy. The indoor pool area was great, again very clean, lots of towels. Room service was super fast and accurate. The food in the on-site restaurant was delicious and served in a very upscale manner. It's close to everything, easy access to all sorts of transportation, beautiful views of the skyline if you're on the river side, big rooms, lots to do. I'd happily stay there again. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to relax with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: handyspanner
Reviews.Content: We stayed in HI MP during the back end of May 2009, while spending half term with my other half. Chose Chicago on the experience of a one day business trip back in 2005 and thought it would be good for a long city break. I must say we were not disappointed, it is a great city with lots to do and see and the food and people make the break a real pleasure. The hotel has a reasonable gym with good indoor pool. The bar is a great place to have a cocktail before you go out and has great views at night. We chose the hotel after reading the reviews on TR and we were not disappointed. When we arrived we were UG to a corner room over looking the river and the Hancock Tower, great view particularly at night. The room was big, like a suite, with King Bed and sofa that could pull down for a bed if required. Additional to a desk we had a table and chairs to eat our breakfast off. There is a CVS round the corner to get all that you need for the simple breakfast, if you do not want a "full size" from the hotel.
