The room had coffee making facilities and a fridge, so that was a bonus also. The hotel is located in a great place as you can walk along Wacker or stroll through the back streets to the mag mile. There are a number of good places to eat in the locality of the hotel. We ate at Lou Malnati's - 439 N. Wells, which was a great rec from TR and the Pizza was to die for, we also ate at Heaven on Seven, which again was a rec from TR, and the food was again excellent. We caught the El from ORD to Clarke and walked to the hotel, this was about 10 mins at the most. The brown line does stop at MP and you could get this from Clarke if you did not want to walk. At $23 I can recommend the 7 day CTA ticket, we used it all the time to get around on the El and on the bus up to Lincoln Park. I could go on and on, but hey you have to find something out for yourself!!! Use the site, people are really helpful and give really good advice. Enjoy Chicago, it is a great City and if you are not sure where to stay go to the Holiday Inn at MP, the staff will welcome you and you will have a good time and it is really quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business or Leisure!”
Reviews.Author: JessManchester
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely! We stayed for three nights on the 23rd floor in May. The weather was about 85 degrees so it was lovely to take a break from sightseeing to relax in the quiet pool in the afternoon whilst it was too hot outside! The view from our window was wonderful - got the Chicago skyline looking North with the John Hancock Centre. If you are on the other side you can see Sears Tower! The hotel bar has great skyline views too so you don't miss out if your room doesn't have them. Good access to The Loop and easy to get around from here as its only a 20 minute walk or so to Lake Michigan and Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay again in a heartBeat”
Reviews.Author: Dorp
Reviews.Content: I used to travel to Chicago on a regular basis. I stayed on Michigan Ave. and it was noisy all night long. This hotel has lobby on 15th floor so it is up from the hustle and bustle, river runs on side or front so there is not heavy traffic. Was close enough to Michigan ave. that could walk and was able to walk or take short cab ride to most locations downtown. Breakfeast buffet good but has gone up quite a bit. Always clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, not a super busy location”
Reviews.Author: gobluegirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel this past weekend and it was a great location for me. On previous trips I have stayed right on Michigan Avenue and that gets to be a bit crazy with all the weekend tourist! This trip I wanted to spend more time on State Street and Rush Street and this location was perfect for me. I was in walking distance of everything (including Mich Ave) or a short cab ride away. The hotel itself was under going renovations, we had a nice new updated room. The bathrrom was very big with a nice shower. The room itself was specious with two double beds and a flat screen TV. The bed was comfortable, however I would have preferred a queen as opposed to the double. You enter the building at ground level and take the elevator up to the 15th floor. The lobby, bar and restaurant are located here. Check in was very easy, the staff was very friendly and nice. The bar had a nice view of the city and the drinks were delivered very promptly. I would stay here again, but request a king or two queens.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, rennovation nearly complete”
Reviews.Author: SeattleCrazyhair
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inns can kind of be a crap shoot, but this one was much better than your typical Holiday Inn. My room had a nice view and was large, with a comfortable bed. Earlier reviewers found it difficult to find....but I had no problem (the lobby is on the 15th floor, but there is a doorman on the 1st floor who directs you to the elevator). The business center was closed when I was there, but they let me use a computer & printer in the office.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay - Renovation almost complete!”
Reviews.Author: FormerWindyCity
Reviews.Content: Second stay here, this time two nights, enjoying the flat screen television, cozy duvets on the beds and the four pillows to luxuriate in. The lure of Earth Hour brought us back this particular weekend. The renovation is almost complete and the lobby area looks fabulous. Unfortunately, the new restaurant was opening the day after my stay, but we enjoyed the great breakfast via room service one morning and the temporary location the next. Just as in my previous review, the restaurant staff is amazing. Everyone is so pleasant, helpful and genuinely happy to be working in their hotel. Dined in Cityscape Friday night and fell completely in love with Tony Miu's Zentini, a wicked combination of Skyy Citrus, Zen Green Tea Liqueur and lime juice, followed by an equally wicked Grand Pandaro Cheese Pasta, all while watching the beautiful night skyline along the river. Earlier in the day we had watched the Chicago Police boats going back and forth past Wolf Point and the river tour boats have already started service. Wish it had been warmer so we could have enjoyed some outdoor activity too. This trip we got to the gym and were very impressed with the equipment available. Everything was spotlessly clean to begin with and there were wipes and sprays available to clean the equipment before and after use, which gives great peace of mind. There's stacks of fresh clean towels and a convenient spot to drop the soiled towels, so everything stays invitingly clean, unlike many gyms.There is also a very nice sauna in the same area, but we hadn't thought to bring swimwear this trip, so no pool - no sauna. Next time for certain! Cityscape was a verrrry popular spot for Earth Hour so alas, we thought we'd have a better view from our room. We settled in front of the expanse of windows and watched as the lights went off in many downtown landmarks. It was gratifying to see how many people became involved in the energy saving movement, including, of course, the hotel who even doused the parking lot lighting. Once again, a completely enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “It did the job”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Roamer
Reviews.Content: I should note that the date of the reservation and subsequent stay was in December, so some of the details may be a bit blurry, but much of the memory is still there. We arrived a bit before checkin, but the early check in was not a problem for the desk clerk. She quickly found the reservation and sent us up to our room, which was on the 22nd floor as I recall. When I called in the reservation, I remember talking with an operator who tried to talk me out of getting the room with a view; she said that just about all of the rooms have a wonderful view and that it probably wouldn't be necessary to pay extra for that feature. Somehow, though, I read "room with a view" to be "corner room". Needless to say, I was sorely disappointed it was not. Don't get me wrong, the view was still great (see the photo with this review), but I don't think it was anything for which I needed to pay extra. The room was clean and seemed a bit roomier than most hotel rooms in which I am accustomed to staying. Housekeeping did a great job every day. Everything looked great. It is a standard hotel room; I mean it's clean, had a great view, and you're in Chicago, so how much time will you actually be spending in your room? Pool seemed a bit cool, as others have noted. It also was a bit too crowded for my liking, so I didn't get to enjoy it too much. Again, as others noted, the food prices looked quite a bit too high to justify eating in the hotel, but again, you're going to be in Chicago. Get outside of the hotel. Do go to the bar at least once during your stay; the view is absolutely magnificent. I could justify drink prices that were a bit higher for that view--right at the fork of the Chicago River. The open air courtyard was nice. It was relaxing and the open feel was nice to see when leaving the room. I was quite tempted to get some of those little plastic soldiers with parachutes and drop a bunch of them to see them fall down to the courtyard, but thankfully, was talked out of it. The hotel is accessible via enclosed walkways all the way from the brown line station (Merchandise Mart). Some previous reviews I read noted that the walkway wasn't open on the weekends. I didn't find that to be the case, but it seemed as though there was a special event going on that weekend, so I'm not sure if that was a fluke or a new rule. Finally, I gave 5/5 for value. Since the stay I'm reviewing in Dec. 2008, it appears as though the hotel has raised it rates and substantially. If I'd paid the current amount for the room, I'd probably give it a 4/5 for value. The location is right near the heart of Chicago, yet far enough away that you're not awakened by sirens and/or traffic and/or trains. You'd be hard pressed to find a better location in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: docmjc
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay. There are significant renovations going on, but they appear to be nearing completion and they were limited to the lobby area and did not interfere with our stay in any way. The location is awesome, linked to Merchandise Mart (by an enclosed bridge) where there is a stop on the brown line subway. Lots of restaurant options within walking distance or by train. We did not swim in the pool but it was very pretty. The view from the room was very nice with city lights. However, we stayed on the west side of the buliding facing away from the lake and city, and I think the view would be even better from the east side. The truly amazing thing about this place is the value. The public rate on the room was pretty reasonable for being in the city. The amazing thing is the AAA discount which was over 40%. I am already a AAA member, but even if I was not, I would have saved over $100 on our three night stay even after incurring the cost of joining AAA. The only negative thing I can say is that the room was decorated a bit on the plain side, but it was spotless and perfectly acceptable. There is parking, but it was expensive as it is with most hotels in the city.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Arizona, new mexico, missouri, texas, indianna, californa
Reviews.Title: “They could have told me this place was under total renovation.”
Reviews.Author: Intranet
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay here over the phone. I had stayed here before, and it was great. Not this time, though. The lobby is in shambles. The ceiling is gone, wires hanging down, the fumes of fresh paint, "Beware of dust" signs plastered all over the lobby. Horrible stuff. I got to the front counter, and asked what the deal was, and accomplished nothing. I just kept finding myself asking why it was not possible to tell me that they were undergoing absolute and complete renovation over the phone while I was booking my stay. The room was no better. Green paint, a 1976ish theme, and just a general plainness. I also couldn't get any internet, which is a huge problem for me. The only redeeming quality was a fairly good view of chicago, and a canal just below my window.

Reviews.Title: “Still under renovation, traffic noise, not what I hoped for.”
Reviews.Author: twoteachersSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: Based on its amazing views of the river and downtown, I selected the Holiday Inn for a four night business trip. The first night's rate was very reasonable, but nights #2-4 were nearly double. Other comments about the difficulty in finding the hotel are well founded; the signage is inadequate. Exiting the elevator on the 15th floor, where the hotel begins, one is met with NO signs or personnel, just some construction work in progress. Turning the corner, though, and you can find your own way to the reception. At that point you realise that the HI signature dining room beneath the atrium is not there, or at least it isn't finished, so meals are served in two other locations. The bar overlooking the city is very pleasant, though you should check carefully what you order, and not assume you'll be given a promotion/cut-price drink unless you explicitly ask for it. The rooms are adequate in terms of amenities, and the exercise room/indoor pool really quite nice. But the major drawbacks are - apart from the dining issues - the constant rumble/occasional roar from the trains etc. below the hotel, and the workers who began their hammering at 6:50 am. To make the most of its location, the hotel needs a signifcant upgrade on its double/triple glazing, and either it should close while construction is underway, or it should warn the guests and require its building workers to hold off until, say, 8 am. Personally, I was disappointed, and I checked out by 8:30 am, finding another Chicago hotel for the same price that was drastically better on every level except the absence of a pool. By the way, don't use the internet facility in the rooms - they have obsolete software, and many major sites (including, ironically, orbitz.com) can't be accessed. When I complained about this, I was refunded the cost, but other than that there was only a half-hearted apology from the front desk. I expect they're weary about the current situation too, but when you have the choices Chicago can offer, this is a recipe for customer disenchantment and longterm disaffection.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom3333
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms. COLD pool. There is NO WAY this was a heated pool. Weren't able to utilize it and this was one reason for wanting to stay here. Hotel was near public transit, which made it convenient to get around. Staff was friendly. Restaurant had good food. No free continental breakfast served though.

Reviews.Title: “It was your typical holiday inn - just fine”
Reviews.Author: Ringettechick
Reviews.Content: We ran a conference here in November and stayed 2 nights. I got upgraded to a corner suite which was great to start off with, then you find out in the corner suites on that side of the building the rooms don't reach the free internet signal. Bedroom: Large corner suite, good layout. Ok bed, not the Westin or anything. Bathroom: just ok We did our event in the Wolf Point ballroom, which was gorgeous with full windows on 2 sides. Typical Holiday Inn banquet food, however great banquet service which exceeded my expectations. Restaurant: just ok Location: Could've been better it was a long 30 minute walk to get across to the bridge to anything decent. Great view though! Conceirge: WOW - he was excellent - wonderful maps & service. I believe his name was Ron. There are other options closer to nightlife and more things to do. It was ok for one night, but on the 2nd night I wish we were closer to restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, and I rate difficultly!”
Reviews.Author: NukedNative
Reviews.Content: Ok, I went to priceline, entered where I wanted to stay and crossed my fingers. Found the hotel that accepted my rate, and again, crossed my fingers. Read some reviews on the hotel and was a little concerned, everyone complaining about using two elevators, and how terrible the people who worked there were. I was apprehensive from the start, ready for the worst, but when I arrived, the bellman gave simple directions (there were 6 of us, to include a 13 y/o 8 y/o and 3 y/o..) to get up to the hotel. Walk in the revolving door, by the escalator and take the elevator. WOW.. And people had compained about THAT? Ok, I figured it had to get much worse. Upstairs, at check in where the "rude obnoxious" desk people were according to another review, stood these two women who were MORE than happy to help us, and even went the extra mile to find us adjoining rooms, on the same floor as the pool deck. Ok, we went to the rooms, yes did take another elevator, but we made it with no effort (remember 3 kids!). Got to the room and expected the huge CSI crime scene another reviewer posted about, and the rooms were immaculate. I opened the curtain expecting a view commensurate with what I had paid, and POOF, there was the Chicago Skyline. Hancock Building one way, and Sears tower another, along with the river right below us. Yes, the restaraunt is over priced, but 3 blocks away is a fast food restaraunt. We used room service for desert only and had no problems with the delivery or service. The pool was a little chilly, but I believe it to be because the pool deck was kept at 80 degrees. The water was great once you were in it. Fitness room with a sauna was superb. If you want a complaint from me, it will only be that next time I use priceline, Sadly I am afraid that my experience won't be this great.

Reviews.Title: “They gave my room away!”
Reviews.Author: sinclairpub
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the reservationist and had also received a nice email response when I inquired about the location. However, when I arrived at midnight after a grueling delayed flight, I was told they were overbooked. Apparently other guests decided to extend their stay, so they gave my room away. The hotel did rebook me and paid for the other hotel, but as a business traveler...that didn't help me personally since my client pays the bill. I was the one inconvenienced. I had to stay a mile away, and had to fight for a taxi to come back to my meeting in the mart early the next morning. This cost me much needed sleep. I would have appreciated an email or phone call telling me about the problem so I could have planned accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: akisha
Reviews.Content: Pros - As other reviewers have mentioned the hotel is situated at the heart of downtown chicago .Few minutes from most of the popular attractions.There is a taxi stand just outside the hotel,which adds to the benefit. The rooms are mediocre. Cons - Expensive Food , Rude Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Chicago Mart Plaza”
Reviews.Author: AnnWieringa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel with 5 of my friends. We had very nice rooms, excellent service from everyone at the hotel. The concierge was very helpful with the planning of our vacation. The only complaint we had was that too much food was served with our meals. It seemed like a waste but I guess a lot of people would think lots of food was a really good thing. Food served in the restaurant was delicious and the wait staff very good also. The City Scape Bar is an excellent place just to relax at the end of the day and overlook the city lights. Overall experience was excellent and would highly recomend to any age group.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wee_burd
Reviews.Content: First impression is that the hotel is a bit strange - you have to go up to the 15th floor in order to get to the reception. The room was great and we had a great view of the river. We ordered room service one night and had a great meal. The bar on the main level had some great views of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,great views of the city and the river”
Reviews.Author: Clttravelor
Reviews.Content: It is a super location next to the mart and convienent to good places to eat. It is a bit strange to enter on the main level and then must travel to the front desk on a upper floor. It is your basic city hotel but it offers beautiful scenery from the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, above average hotel, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: rcf2
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The view was excellent (if you get a view of the river). The hotel itself was above average, clean, and had a nice bar with a great view. Great downtown location. The staff could be rude, though- we had problems with the concierge (who didn't seem to want to be bothered), and room service (who told us "they were too busy" to bring some things up to our room, and we "could come down and get it ourselves").

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and Great Views in the Heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: GJK3
Reviews.Content: Located at Chicago's Merchandise Mart in the heart of the Magnificent Mile, this Holiday Inn is perched atop the Chicago Sun Times building and the underground shopping mall known as the Merchandise Mart. Easily accessible from both Midway (about 8 stops on the CTA) and O'Hare (about an hour by CTA). Trains on the Loop stop at the Merchandise Mart, which is virtually at the hotel's doorstep. Better signs in the Mart would help guests find the hotel after exiting the CTA train. Rooms are small but comfortably appointed. Free Internet was great. Many rooms feature fabulous views of Chicago's lively canyon of art deco buildings and newer skyscrapers. The hotel's bar is an all-glass venue overlooking the river with the city's dazzling lights spread out before you. The spacious atrium hosts the hotel's "Regions" restaurant that features a nice variety of entrees, sandwiches, and salads. The hotel's location could hardly be better. An easy walk to Wacker Drive, State Street, Dearborn and Michigan Avenues. The River Walk is just yards from the hotel. A concierge desk sits in the lobby but is not always staffed. The front desk is very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful but somewhat understaffed. I had to wait in long lines to get information I needed. The only complaint I have about the room is that the walls are a little thin. I could hear an annoying cellphone conversation in the neighboring room. All things considered, this is a good Holiday Inn convenient to shopping, restaurants and a CVS drugstore.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Strongs
Reviews.Content: We booked this on priceline for our trip back for a Cubs and Bears game. We really liked this hotel and feel like we got a good deal on priceline. Loved that there was a Dunkin Donuts and other fast food choices right in the merch mart. Great for access to the Brown Line. It was clean, comfortable, nice staff, great lobby and bar with a great view! Liked that the parking lot was close and and accesable. We would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for downtown”
Reviews.Author: Junius
Reviews.Content: Very convenient hotel for touring Chicago. Comfortable and efficient accommodation, although restaurants in the hotel itself too pricey for us! Sits atop the Chicago Sun-Times building and a five minute walk via second level walkway through Merchandise Mart (massive office complex with lots of shops + eating outlets) to the CTA station for easy access to the 'El' (elevated railway). Alternatively downtown shops etc 15 minute walk. Far cleaner and safer feel to this city than we had expected. 1,2, 3 or 5-day 'Visitor Pass' for all public transport recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: lyso1
Reviews.Content: A nice and very central hotel. We had rooms on the 21th floor which gave us a really nice view of the Chicago river. The staff is friendly and helpful. Good beds to sleep in. However, the maids forgot to change toilet paper. On the third day we ran out of toilet paper and it was not fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: karench14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were doing a driving trip that started in NJ and landed us in Chicago for 3 days. We booked this hotel through hotwire for $164/night. Because it was hotwire, we couldn't count on getting a queen or king bed and in fact we had 2 doubles. The beds were nice and comfortable. The location is above the Chicago Sun Times offices so you have to take an elevator up to the 15th floor to check in. After that you take another elevator across the lobby to your floor. Our room overlooked the indoor pool and was a nice enough set up. One problem in the room was the air conditioner. It violently shut itself on and off so that it actually startled us a little each time! To be fair, we did not complain about it so the hotel didn't have a chance to correct it but it made sleeping a little tough. I like hotels with gyms and this one was pretty good for a hotel gym. It had nice cardio equipment and some weights. My husband used the pool and it had so much cholorine that it burned his eyes - and he is usually not sensitive to that. The hotel itself is in a great location and there are some really good restaurants within walking distance. If you like Thai, go to Star of Siam, which is recommended on the hotel site. It's about 8 blocks from the hotel, delicious, and well priced. We also ate at the Chop House (also within walking distance). A well known spot in Chicago, it's a bit pricey but it's a fancy restaurant with amazing food (get the sweet potato with cinnamon butter - it's beyond delicious). We loved the aquarium (we walked to it and then ran along the lake but it's a bit far if you are just looking to visit). It has beluga whales and some interesting exhibits. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would return to this great location”
Reviews.Author: Don_woody
Reviews.Content: We met some friends here for a long weekend. Top floor view of the river facing south, worth the extra $10 as we enjoyed cocktails in our room with the view. The brown line eL stop is less than a 5 minute walk through the merchandise mart. The mart has several place to eat, some sit down, some fast food (dunkin donut). Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mutiger97
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just got home for a three-day girls getaway in Chicago. I booked the Holiday Inn Mart Plaza hotel via Priceline for $120/night + tax, which was a great deal for the location and timeframe. I was pleasantly surprised - the location was great. It was about mile from Union Station as well as the Magnificent Mile. We walked everywhere from our hotel, but it's close to the El as well. Thought the rooms were fairly average, but clean. We also had a great experience at check-in. We arrived around 1 and were quickly checked into our room even though check-in wasn't until 3. The hotel clerk was quite courteous. I had read some reviews where clerks had been somewhat rude to customers booking through priceline. I definitely did not have that experience. Also the hotel bar was great - located on the corner of the building overlooking the Chicago River. It had a wonderful view and the drinks were extremely reasonably priced. All in all - had a great visit and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel + superb location”
Reviews.Author: zak63
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights end of JUN with my family. The property is conveniently located . The room was , confortable clean and nice. Property has a beautiful indor pool and an excercise room available until late in the evening . breakfast area and bar within the hotel are offering good choice of meals/drink Hotel is connected with mart plaza and with EL metro lines using internal passageway. A good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: Patriot27
Reviews.Content: The beds at this hotel are some of the worst that I can remember. I unfortunately was attending a two-day conference and had already prepaid for the rooms - a sofa would have been more comfortable. The beds also had three small pillows that were the size of a "throw pillow" - it was very awkward. Overall the hotel rooms, hallways, and lobby were very dated and in need of a make over. There are some good points to this hotel. There is free WIFI, location is okay but will probably need a cab to get to most places, nice bar with sweeping views of the city and river - some rooms also have this view. Also, the staff was very friendly and concierge "Robert" was helpful with restaurant recommendations and can get you last minute tickets to shows or the Cubs. If you can afford it, stay next time at a hotel that is closer to Miracle Mile, the Pier, or Millennium Park. By staying at this hotel you'll end up spending money on cab rides and have a bed made of rock awaiting you when you get back from your night out on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but an average hotel experience..”
Reviews.Author: drbabbers
Reviews.Content: Location: Ideal location in Chicago, easy to commute to most main attractions and shops. Staff: Everyone we spoke to was very helpful. The lady who checked us in was quite miserable, but nevertheless they all seemed ok. Hotel: The hotel itself was OK. The hotel is sat on the top of a tower block starting at the 15th floor. When you arrive at the foot of the tower it is not straight forward on how you actually get to the hotel, we managed to find out by asking a gentleman, who had a similar experience. The room itself was very spacious but at the same time very average. We had problems with reliable hot water in the bathroom, most of the time the water was warm but not hot. We had a fairly decent nights sleep, although in the early hours I am sure I could hear what sounded like a washing machine going, which was quite loud. Although being high up is a good thing as you get no traffic noise. Another thing worth mentioning is the tremendous view of the surrounding city, from your room this is a visually stunning experience. Main features in the hotel are the beautiful swimming pool on the 16th floor along with the impressive fitness center. Also the lobby area and dining is visually impressive, the bar in particular offering great views looked very good. As with most Holiday Inn's the price to eat in their diner is a joke, you are looking at 30 dollars minimum or so per person for a standard meal which you can get down the road for half the price. Overall: If you want an OK hotel in a good Chicago location then this may be a good move, however for the $180 a night rate I am sure if you looked around you could do better. Everything about the general hotel is good, however the room itself is the weakest point.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel...pleasant but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: hrh333
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable. Could use a bit of modernization. Staff was acceptable but did not go out of their way. Concierge had a hard time recommending a place for dinner. Free wifi was nice, but parking was expensive ($28), though comparable for this part of Chicago. Location was fatastic. The hotel bar has one of the most spectacular views I have seen of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: UK_Yankee_fan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on the first leg of a stay in the US from the UK. Arrived early afternoon to find the allocated room was not yet ready. A quick recognition of my Platinum Status opened up quickly a Riverview room (which I haD paid for). Platinum Status also recognised with some nice extra's. The room 2101 was a spectacular corner room with views of the city and river. Clean, fresh and plenty of natural light during the day. Only minor niggle was the door on the TV cabinet would not stay open. Free high speed internet in the room was of a good speed. Location is excellent - short walk to the Brown line with most of the main attractions within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “They don't like Priceline Customers - even a $175 bid a night cutomer”
Reviews.Author: Cyclone94
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, we were told since we booked through Priceline we would not be able to guarantee what we asked for. At first all they said were smoking rooms. After we explained we had a rough morning where we had something ripped off from us on the train, she seemed more sympathetic and gave us room 2316. The joke was on us. It was an incredibly small room, double bed, and the decor from 1950's and not updated since. It was so upsetting. Especially since we over bid on priceline for $175 for this hotel and still getting treated like this. After a few hours, my husband went to talk to a gentleman at the front desk and asked if there were any king bed non smoking openings. Thankfully there were. We got 1808 - still gret view of teh river and sooo much more room and nicer decor. It saved the trip. I was surprised by being treated like 3rd class citizens here since we booked on Priceline. I had recently stayed at a Marriott in San Diego and booked that via Priceline and had the most fantiastic service ever from a hotel. We did get room service breakfast, which was okay. They forgot salt and pepper and I wanted tobassco for my eggs. Went I went down to the restaurant to ask for some, I was not greated with the warmest "what can we do for you" I had to barter for more salt. I guess it's had to come by in Chicago. We've been to Chicago many times via Priceline, but this was the worst experience yet for service and room. I would not stay here again due to service. Maybe if you book directly with the hotel you would get better service than an online disount place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: Lisamarch
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal but I booked directly with property 7 months prior to stay. Our room was nice enough and had a GREAT view! It was wonderful. Bathroom had peeling and stained wallpaper. It's about time for an update. Suprising that the bar, which serves food, allowed kids at 2:00 p.m. but at 4:00 p.m. when we tried to enter, we got turned away for having a 5-year old with us. That was disappointing since it's certainly not a state law - our child goes with us to drinking establishments that serve food all the time. I didn't think self parking was that expensive or difficult. I'd go here again if the price beats elsewhere downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Haroldlhas2trvl
Reviews.Content: I stayed on business at this location. Very convenient location as it was next to Merchandise Mart. I had a nice view of the river and the accommodations were nice. Rooms were big enough to make you feel like you have some space. The parking is a little steep and I did not get a chance to eat at the hotel, but otherwise a decent stay. I am a PC member and they treated me well.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good bet if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: deparker
Reviews.Content: I got another great price on Priceline. Last time I stayed here I gor a fabulous room with a fantastic view of the Chicago River and the Sears Tower. Since I've seen that view, I decided to get a quiet room away from the elevator this time. Not much of a view of the "courtyard" and the top of the pool. However, it was quiet, and nicely furnished. The tub could have used a re-coating though. It was peeling a bit. Still all in all, it is a nice, comfortable hotel in River North and it is easy to get arounf the city. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Kitten78
Reviews.Content: As we have been traveling to Chicago several times now, we have tried several hotels too. This is one of the best so far. We came in by train from New York and it was only a short walk from Union Station. The hotel is on the top floors of a pretty tall building, so you have to take the elevator up a few floors to get to the lobby. The lobby looked good, and had theire own staffed information desk were you could ask all kinds of questions, get directions and tips. Check in was fast and the staff was polite. The room was spaciouse with to beds, a desk and a big tv. The bathroom was nice, big and clean. The hotel was situated within walkingdistance of all the major attractions and there was alot of restaurants near by. We especially loved Rock Bottom Sportsbar and Restaurant. Great spare ribs, great prices. This hotel is worth every penny, would stay there again in a hearbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SATanthony
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel at a great deal through orbitz from san antonio..the room had an excellent view of the river and downtown area..what i liked the best was that the brown line (cta public transportation) connects right into the merchandise mart where the hotel is located, there are also fast food eateries right in the mart..I found the hotel staff to be very friendly and always helpful..the only downside i found was the rooms, while the view was great there was no microwave, no fridge, also the area doesnt have much to offer for late night eating..you of course have the option of room service (not really cheap) until 1:30 am ..nothing really within walking distance unless you want to take a $ 5 cab ride towards the magnificent mile. I would recommend this hotel highly and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Chicago hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Travel76
Reviews.Content: I've actually stayed at the Holiday Inn Mart Plaza twice. Once for a wedding (the reception was held in the banquette room with the spectacular view) and the other was just recently when I brought my nephew downtown for his birthday. Not many of the Chicago hotels have a pool but this one does. They have some nice breakfast choices...but room service is a bit pricey. They offer parking at a reasonable rate, but the cars are not covered as they sit in an outside parking area. There are very steep steps down to the parking area. There is a drive-up area to the front entrance. The hotel lobby itself is situated on the 15th floor so you need to take an elevator up once you enter the building. I've always seemed to find the cheapest rates on the Holiday Inn website. They provided us a room with a wonderful view of the river and Sears Tower. Its easy to get a cab. If you walk 2 blocks you can catch the el. The hotel rooms were average size. We had 2 double beds, desk , 2 chairs, tv with lots of first run and just released DVD selections for an additional fee. Video game rental for an additional fee. Electronic checkout. Bathroom was large and brightly lit. We went at Christmas time so the lobby was all decorated. Overall its a great place to stay for the price, but if you want to walk out onto Michigan Ave its a bit too west .

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat out of the way, but still a decent downtown choice”
Reviews.Author: velevele
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights over the Christmas holidays and was overall pleased with this hotel, although the location is not optimal for sightseeing in downtown Chicago. Positives â€“ I booked through Priceline, and I had heard ahead of time that this particular hotel was unfriendly to Priceline customers. That wasnâ€™t my experience at all. The check-in clerk was very friendly and competent, asked about my room preferences (bed size and smoking/non), and gave me an excellent room that met my preferences. At check-out I had the same very helpful clerk, who seemed genuinely interested in how my stay was. There were no problems whatsoever with the bill. â€“ I loved the room â€“ huge (king-size bed, full-size couch, and lots of floor space to spare), and a nice view west over the Chicago River and Chicago landmarks to the west (United Center, Ogilvie station, etc). Since the rooms begin above the 15th floor, you get a nice overlook. I didnâ€™t ask for a room with a view so I was thrilled to have been given one. â€“ The room was kept very clean. â€“ The water pressure and temperature in the shower were both fine. â€“ The rate I got through Priceline was extremely reasonable ($65/night). â€“ The Merchandise Mart el stop (Brown Line), food court, and shops are convenient. The exit from the el stop is directly into Merchandise Mart; this exit was always open during my visit and always staffed with a CTA staff member. â€“ The hotel was very quiet. I heard no street noise or noise from other guests. I did hear noise from the Ogilvie train station just to the southwest of the hotel, but I donâ€™t find train noise irritating, and I enjoyed watching the trains pull in and out of the station. Negatives/other factors â€“ This hotel is not especially close to the Mag Mile or the Loop, although itâ€™s certainly within walking distance for healthy adults. Itâ€™s not really close enough to just â€œpop inâ€� during the day and drop off bags, etc. If you want to be within a block or two of Michigan Avenue or other downtown attractions, you may wish to choose another hotel. There are several good River North restaurants close to the hotel, however. (I would recommend researching nearby restaurants in advance.) â€“ The hotel has a pedway that connects the hotelâ€™s building with the Merchandise Mart, and when this pedway is open, you can walk directly from the hotel to the Merchandise Mart el stop without having to go outside, which was great during the early dark cold winter nights. (You also thus avoid the dark and deserted area under the Wells Street part of the el.) However, the pedway is not always open; the Sunday I stayed at the hotel, it wasnâ€™t open at all, and the weather was brutal that day. When the pedway isnâ€™t open, neither are the Wells and Orleans street exits from the mart, and you need to take the stairs or elevator down one floor, exit the mart at its south entrance (about halfway between Wells and Orleans streets), and walk outside to the hotel from there (about 3/4 block total). This pedway was, however, open late on Saturday night and also late on Christmas Eve. â€“ The hotel entrance is not necessarily that obvious (itâ€™s on the south side of the building). You can use Google Mapsâ€™ street view to get a look at it ahead of time, which is helpful. â€“ If you want any el other than the Brown Line, you have to transfer either downtown or further north at Fullerton. â€“ This hotel (in my room at least) is still using the blanket/bedspread system â€“ I much prefer the duvet system. The bed was adequate but not as comfortable as those in, say, Hiltons or Westins. â€“ The two lamps by the bed were not as bright as I would have liked. â€“ You have to transfer elevators to get to your room. One elevator takes you from ground level to the lobby on the 15th floor, and a second set of elevators goes to floors 15 and above. My room was on 17 so I usually took the stairs (well lit and unlocked on all levels). â€“ I didnâ€™t eat in the hotel at all so canâ€™t comment on that. In summary, for the price I paid via Priceline, I was more than satisfied with this hotel. All in all, I prefer the convenience of the many hotels in the Loop and nearer the Mag Mile, but this hotel was still within a reasonable distance, and the convenience of the el stop and the pedway (when open) made it more amenable to getting around than I had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Choice”
Reviews.Author: ezpass
Reviews.Content: Nice downtown hotel. Clean, friendly, very good buffet breakfast (for extra $15). Stayed after thanksgiving for 4 nights, $230 per night including taxes. Great view for part of the rooms (see photo attached). 1 Mile from Mag. Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Ichiro888
Reviews.Content: When checking in on a recent business trip to Chicago, the front desk personnel noticed that I have booked the room through a discount travel website. Then she automatically assigned me to the worst smoking room in the whole place, right next door to the entry to their exercise room, without even looking to see if there was a non-smoking room. I told her that I am not a smoker. She said, "The room isn't that bad". Obviously she had not been in that room before. Then, she suggested that next time I book a room directly with them if I wanted a non-smoking room. The smell in the room was so bad that I had to go out in the middle of the first night and get a couple of deodorizer sprays. The room smelled like a filthy ashtray. Upon returning home, I had to spend nearly $100 on dry cleaning bill. It seems Holiday Inn have signed up discount travel website to just to fill their worst rooms that would not normally sell under any circumstances. What infuriates me the most is that during my stay, the place was practically empty. For a discount of mare $15 off their regular rate per night ($165 during my stay), this experience left me with disgust and anger over the management and business relationship between lodging industry and discount travel websites. Lastly but not the least, when checking out of this dump to go to the Oâ€™Hare airport, the doorman kept me waiting for a cab (special cab) nearly thirty minutes, while not calling for any other cab. When the special cab arrived, it was an off-duty cab of his buddy who splits proceeds of the fare with him. That just tops it all with my nightmare experience with this Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected...”
Reviews.Author: danaleste
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Mart Plaza on Nov. 16-18. It was just a weekend get-a-way. The hotel is situated in the top Â½ of the Chicago Sun Times Building so you may miss it. We had to wait for a bellman to come get our luggage. There was only 1 guy on duty it seemed, but he was doing a great job. We did see other bellmen in the hotel lobby just standing around so Iâ€™m not sure why there was only 1 bellman assisting guests when we arrived. The hotel lobby is on the 15th floor as others have stated. We had valet parking but the attendants werenâ€™t always available so I suggest self parking which is $10 cheaper. The hotel is pretty dated so but be deceived by the pix. We booked thru Priceline. We asked for a non-smoking king with a lake-view. They were most unaccommodating. We received a non-smoking double room which faced the inner court with a view of the swimming pool and other guestsâ€™ rooms. From my experience it seems that hotels are less accommodating for people who book reservations through online discounted sources. The rooms were nice, nothing special at all. Walls are a little thin but we didnâ€™t experience any extreme noise throughout our stay. The water pressure in the shower was very low. They have free wireless internet which worked great. The hotel is a decent walking distance from the main downtown area (MI Ave) but the weather wasnâ€™t extremely cold. I would recommend driving or taking a cab to get around when temps are less than 40 degrees. Thereâ€™s also not too much activity in that area. We happened to experience the Christmas lighting of MI Ave. There was a parade also. It was really exciting!! Thereâ€™re plenty of restaurants and shopping and other things to do in Chicago. If youâ€™re in Chicago, please stop by Garrettâ€™s on MI Ave. Their popcorn is deee-licious but you will have to wait in line so be prepared (it is WORTH it)! If youâ€™re looking for a great dining experience, check out the Melting Pot. But plan to be there for 3+ hours; the service is not slow â€“ itâ€™s just a FULL dining experience. Everything is cooked directly on your table. It was the best lunch/dinner experience Iâ€™ve had. The chocolate fondue for dessert was the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Bland and Sad”
Reviews.Author: TakemewithyoutoLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in a sad looking room, with no view. The place was clean but could use a major over haul. Having a meal in the atrium is like eating in an airport. The pool is good however as is the fitness center. The staff were friendly. The location is withing walking distance of the main attractions, but it feels to be a little bit cut off from the energy of a city center hotel. There is a good grocery story in the lobby which serves great sandwitches

Reviews.Title: “Adequate choice for Chicago”
Reviews.Author: sc4eva
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Chicago (Merchandise Mart) is correctly described as adequate. Stayed here for two nights as part of a quick trip to Chicago. Picked the hotel for the price above all but in some ways I guess you get what you pay for. Location: The hotels location isn't horrible; itâ€™s just not that convenient. Youâ€™re close to River North and the Loop but not too much nightlife or shopping. It gets frustrating after the first couple days of navigating several elevators, flights of stairs, escalators and hallways just to get to a cab or train station. The hotel is good choice if you want to save some cash and don't mind walking a couple extra blocks to reach some sites. Rooms/Hotel: Clean just very plain and somewhat dated. Beds were OK and there was also the pillow menu which is standard at most Holiday Inn's now. Bathrooms were basic the lighting was too strong. Free Wi-Fi in all guest rooms. Restaurant: Didn't eat at the hotel because we thought it was way too over-priced. (Tip - Inside the merchandise mart is a food court that serves breakfast very quickly and cheaply). Check out Blueprint in the Merchandise Mart for close cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: rynmcn
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the worst service ever. My company booked 28 rooms at this hotel, When we tried to cancel three nights in two of the rooms they charged us a $400 cancelation fee, even though we gave them 2 months notice. I tried to explain to them that I will cancel all 28 rooms if they charge us this fee, yet they don't understand that they will lose all this money, plus the extras like our dinners in the restaurant, parking, etc. They still made us pay the cancellation charge. Apparently they don't quite understand customer service, and how it can cost a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average otherwise”
Reviews.Author: deych00
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Mart Plaza is rated as a 3-star hotel and I feel it is rated appropriately. It is located in downtown Chicago overlooking the river. The location is very nice, it is within walking distance to most of the Chicago attractions. Parking at the hotel is $27 per day. Hotel is situated on top of the Merchandise Plaza building. Lobby is on the 15th floor, hotel rooms are from 15th through 23rd floors. You have to use 2 sets of elevators to get to your room. First, from 1st to 15th floor, then use hotel elevators that will get you to your floor. We were on the 18th floor and the view was very nice. When I initially booked the room on the HOTWIRE, it doesn't specify which room it is,,, king, queen, smoking, non-smoking, etc. But the hotel was very accomodating and gave us a king non-smoking room. Staff and concierge were very corteous and knowledgeable. Room and bathroom were clean and of average size. However, it felt like the rooms need to be freshened up, maybe new decor and carpeting would do. Mattress was hard. Hotel has a nice size pool and an excercise room. Haven't tried their restaurant but the prices were on the high end. One word of advise if you are driving. The direction says to turn on N.Orleans street but you actually need to turn on Franklin street which becomes N.Orleans. Not knowing this, I kept driving a bit around the hotel and wasn't able to find an entrance. I had to call the front desk from my cell phone to get directions. Overall, if you are looking for a nice hotel in downtown Chicago where you won't need to drive and look for parking spot, Holiday Inn is a good bet. We paid $100 per night booking on Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: TJCCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed Aug. 16-Aug. 19. We flew in to Chicago to celebrate my birthday at my mom's favorite restaurant and catch a game at Wrigley field. Location was perfect. We were only there two and a half days but saw everything. Sears Tower, John Hancock, Michigan Ave, The Navy Pier (ate at Bubba Gump's), watched the Cubs beat the Cards in the rain, took a water taxi down the river and a horse drawn carriage at night. The Hotel has spectacular views. We did not request specific rooms, as we did not plan to be in the hotel much but had a perfect view of Sears Tower. The atrium lobby was nice to sit and have a cocktail before going to bed. Darryl at the bar was awesome. We had dinner at the restaurant the last night and the food was good and reasonably priced. The hotel was clean and the service was great. Don't let the elevators intimidate you, they were no problem. It was a nice stay and without a doubt will always stay at this hotel. If you like fondue, the best fondue around is at Gehaâ€™s CafÃ© in Chicago. It was worth the trip alone.

Reviews.Title: “Different. But I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: bogistcat
Reviews.Content: Not your traditional hotel. Hotel is on floors 15 to 22 of the Chicago-Sun Times building. Do a Google Images search on "Chicago Sun Time Building". Find the picture that says "Chicago Sun Times" on the side and "Holiday Inn" on the rooftop. The hotel lobby is on floor 15. You can see the larger windows on the 15 floor. To get to the Chicago CTA, you have to walk thru the shopping mall part of the Merchandise Mart. The Merchandise Mart mall also has some fast food places, but some are closed on weekends. Furnishings showed some signs of age but they were clean and adequate. City views (if you get a city view room) are spectacular. Good pool, reliable internet connection, good exercise room. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest, but not bad either.”
Reviews.Author: kelnron05
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel at the last minute because it had a pool and complimentary breakfast. We orginally were booked at the Hyatt Regancy. The worst thing about this hotel is that is it 15 floors up and to get from the parking gargage (down a long hallway) to the elevator and then to another elevator to get to your rooms takes about 15 minutes. The rooms were okay. Nothing great about them. The room was clean. The shower water pressure was awesome! The beds were hard. They do have a pillow menu where you can pick the "type" of pillow you would like. We had a nice view of the city. We walked everywhere. It was a long walk w/ 2 children and a stroller but we all survived. We walked to Michigan Ave, Navy Pier and Millenium Park. I think next time we will pick a hotel a little more centrally located. We had free breakfast because it was included in military discount. It was okay. Never would I have paid $15 a person for it!!!! Our bill before the coupons taken off was $59.32 for 2 adults and 2 children. Basic foods: eggs, hashbrowns, bacon, sausage, fruit and bagels.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lupevt
Reviews.Content: I have had very good experiences with Holiday Inns, however this one was a disappointment. My university called ahead of time to pay for the room and confirmed this, but when I got there they had no record of it and were not particularly interested in solving it. Much of the building smelled like roach spray, and when I asked the bell staff for directions one night I got an irritated list of a string of streets that did not help at all. The concierge the following evening was much more helpful. The rooms were clean and the restaurant passable, but I was not overly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs someone to give them the BUSINESS!”
Reviews.Author: orr333
Reviews.Content: I was in town for some business meetings and this hotel offered a rate for the company I was visiting but was still $180 per night. The good: The rooms were clean but still have old fashioned bedspreads. HINT: Get mattress covers and duvets like Hampton! They have a "pillow menu" to get the pillows of your choice delivered. That is a nice touch. This hotel is easily accessed from the trains in Chicago. From MDW, take the orange line to a brown line and get off at Merchandise Mart. It is a short walk through the skyway/pedway to the hotel. The views are very nice. I had a corner (#1745) and had a panoramic view. Now for the bad: I travel frequently for business. The wireless was unavailable to several of our group members. They offered a "box" that picked up the wireless signal and connected like a LAN. Still nothing. Their help line suggested I turn off my virus software. Our company does not allow that and it does not impede my ability to use wireless networks at any other hotel. To check in for my flight, I used the business center. I had to pay $6.47 for the 6 minutes I used the internet. This is a bad feature for a hotel trying to attract business travelers. Nearly every hotel offers this for free now. My colleagues room was 1645 and the smoke smell on that floor and in her room was awful. If it was me, I would have asked to be moved. I think you can do alot better for business travel in Chicago with the other hotels in the vicinity. A few extra bucks is worth being able to connect and use a business center. I would NOT stay here again for that reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Holiday Inn-Mart Plaza!”
Reviews.Author: smittygirls
Reviews.Content: I came back from a trip to Chicago, IL. We stayed at the Holiday Inn-Mart Plaza. I will never ever stay there again! The room had an odor and the vents had not been dusted!! The cleaning personnel stored all the cups and glasses in the same area/room with the soiled and wet towels. When we passed by to go to the lobby to eat, we were taken aback! We didn't use their cups and glasses; we purchased cups at Walgreens. My sister requested a roller-away-bed ($20.00 per night), but she asked that they take it back, because it had a musty ordor. The breakfast buffet was $15.00 per person, that is way too much! I paid over $6000.00 dollars to stay (2 days), but never ever again! You have to pay to use the computer and the printer. The location is great and the lobby is beautiful, but when you go to your room, you're in shock. I wish I had a photo of the room. I believe if you're paying over $600.00 dollars, you should get something free. I could have stayed at another hotel paying the same price. Please learn from my error! Overall, the hotel should tear down and rebuild! I give this hotel one star. Please do not make reservations at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Well...it's a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: juststartedtraveling
Reviews.Content: On this very busy weekend, during which graduation ceremonies were being held at the U of C, hotels in the downtown area were going for at least $250 a night, including the Holiday Inn Mart Plaza. We booked through Priceline about a week prior and were ok with the $147 per night rate. With Chicago's steep tax rate, we ended up paying $166 per night. Not cheap, but at least it we didn't pay full price. We were originally booked at the Club Quarters but decided we might need more space since we travel with a toddler. Both hotels cost the same and, in the end, we traded location for square footage. The Holiday Inn Mart Plaza is located on the northern bank of the river, just before it splits. Although downtown Chicago is very walkable, it seemed most sights and restaurants were right near Michigan and Wacker. So, any sightseeing trip started with either a 15-20 minute walk or a $6 cab ride. If we were to visit Chicago again, we'd probably give the Club Quarters a try. The hotel is housed in the upper 8 floors of the Chicago Sun-Times building and is connected to the Merchandise Mart via a walkway. Although the website and the hotel's tv channel claim that all rooms have a view of the river, they do not. We had a view of the indoor pool. The special Priceline rate did not include breakfast. The hotel staff was always helpful and informative. We arrived at the hotel at 1 p.m. and a gentleman by the name of Angel was nice enough to check us in then instead of 3pm. He also recommended some sites. In the evening, when our toddler wanted milk but all stores were closed, the restaurant staff generously poured us a glass of milk to take to our room at no charge. When you travel with a two-year old, small details like these make all the difference. Just FYI: stores in Chicago close early. The room was clean, although, it needed some updating. Most notably, the hotel has not switched to duvets. They are still using bedspreads which are, well, usually very dirty as they are not changed after each guest. The Holiday Inn Mart Plaza is about a 10 minute walk from the Brown El Line (through the Merchandise Mart) which will take you into the Loop and all other El connections. Wrigley Field and the University of Chicago were each about a 25 minute ride on the El (Wrigley is north and the U of C is south). Nothing else is in very close proximity to the hotel. Everything is about a 20-30 minute walk. Bottom line: The price was good but the location was not great. I would stay a little further east (closer to Lake Michigan) next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Decent Rooms”
Reviews.Author: hutbay
Reviews.Content: Booked the rooms from holiday Inn website, we called to see if we could check-in early and they let us check in at 1:30PM instead of 3PM. Also you can request a room with a view. We booked two rooms at $165 each for 2 nights. Parking is $27 per 24 hours with in and out privilege. I have paid more for hotels downtown without much amenities. The free-wifi was nice. Everything is just a little walk away, make sure you get a map from the concierge at the lobby. They were really helpful. The hotel lobby is pretty nice and the first night after we came back to the hotel, a friend and I just sat there and talked. A CTA transit station is a block away you can get to it through the Merchandise mart. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “View Made It Worth it”
Reviews.Author: Brisas
Reviews.Content: We were on the 21st floor and had a magnificent view of the Chicago River. Staff were friendly and helpful in giving directions to attractions and train routes. Rooms were average. The beds were kind of springy, but somewhat comfortable after a couple of nights there. The bathroom fan didn't work and we were offered another room, but since we had settled and fallen for the view, we opted to go without a fan. Our room keys kept on getting deactivated-happened three times, but they said it was because of carrying them close to cell phones. Housekeeping was late once out of the four days we stayed. We didn't have our room ready when we came back mid-afternoon. The location is in a secluded area-perhaps it was because we stayed during Memorial weekend. When it's a regular work-day there's a hustle and bustle of people coming in and out of the college located in the same building and Merchandise Mart. Go across the walkway to access a foodcourt, CTA Lines, look through the furniture/furnishing showrooms, and post office during the weekdays. Michigan Avenue is about 15-20 minute walk from the hotel. It's a nice walk on a good day or $5 for a cab drive there. With all the walking we did, we got to know the streets real well. We felt pretty safe walking around the area late at night. Parking-On Sunday and Monday (a holiday) we parked for free along Wacker Drive. The other nites, I parked in a parking facility located about a block and a half on Lake & Franklin for $22.25 for 24 hrs vs. the $27/night at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: sassafras
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel that came up with my Priceline bid - far lower than any of the rates I noticed looking thru the reviews quickly & we couldn't have been happier with it. Our stay was over the Memorial Day weekend - Sunday & Monday night. There is an enclosed walkway to the Brown Line (CTA trains) which we discovered was closed except during business days. The walk outside takes just as long as the winding corridor you need to walk thru. The stop across the way makes it quite convenient to all of Chicago. We were not at the hotel much but it was quiet, clean, friendly staff, and very comfortable (especially after the rock hard beds we had stayed at outside the city). Also they held our luggage until we were leaving which made taking one of the last flights out a lot easier. The views were great - we were on the 22nd floor, outside room. The lobby is an open area that extends all the way up creating a square. I do not know if the inner rooms have any kind of view. One reviewer is correct about the restaurants. You are staying in a business district of Chicago so there is not a lot of good restaurants 5 steps from the door but with CTA so convenient that should not stop yoiu from staying here. No matter when you go look into the Go Card thru the CTA if you are not driving - buy it for the number of days needed & pay one price for unlimited use. Also, during the summer months there are a lot of free trolleys to take you to & from the major sites. I had ditched my rental car before checking in so I can not say anything about the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: dcm997
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on-line, without knowing what hotel it was, only the location, star rating and dates. I was originally expecting less than what I got. Stangely, the lobby is on the 15th floor, but what a view!! It takes 2 elevator rides from the ground floor, one to the lobby and another to your room floor. I stayed in a well-appointed room, very clean and extremely comfortable. The view from my 23rd floor room was the best ever. (Thanks to the desk clerk that suggested this room, some of the rooms face other nearby buildings). Ask for a southern view. Smoking is limited to the 16th floor, apparently. I didn't have an opportunity to try the onsite restaurants. The area is safe and very central and I found it very close to shopping, great restaurants and transportation. (Kudos to the CTA, a great service). I'll definitely put this near the top of all hotels I've visited.

Reviews.Title: “good position - beware students!!!”
Reviews.Author: parobbo
Reviews.Content: Excellent position for price - pleasant walk along the river right down to Navy Pier (about 30 mins) - passing State Street, Michigan Ave on way - Must visit Millenium Park on Michigan - lovely relaxing place in midst of all shops! - Hotel great to hop on and off EL train - due to high level of rooms great views of Chicago. Just one problem - BEWARE STUDENTS - there seems to be some connection with the local university (part placed in same building) and those staying in the hotel had no consideration for other guests. Despite me phoning the night-desk they were determined to wake everyone up on their floor. Partying until 3.00am is a bit much for those of use trying to sleep. Otherwise staff very helpful and good bar and restaurant - also many eating places around. Maybe management should consider educating the students or maybe they don't care!!!

Reviews.Title: “adequate -- awkward location”
Reviews.Author: graceh9
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference and the hotel booked late (my bad) and through hotwire ended up about a mile from the hotels where the conference was held. It is actually a lovely walk along the river so that wouldn't be a problem -- except it was a bit of a drag in the rain and snow. Got off to a bad start when greeted with the notice that their Wifi was down -- this is critical to me traveling and I had lots of business I needed to conduct using the net -- so not having this essential tool for 24 hours was a real drawback. I had planned to take care of several important tasks that evening that I couldn't get done because of this. The room was fine. A basic clean holiday inn type room. The view was of the airshaft. At least I didn't end up with a room on the inner lobby which I would imagine would be noisy. Having read about theft in this review site (after I had received the hotwire pick) I looked into leaving my camera and laptop in a safe deposit box while I was out -- their boxes are tiny and won't handle anything but documents. Given their obvious concern about theft (lots written in the documents), it is unfortunate to have neither room safes or adequate security boxes. There is a pretty fair deli on the first floor of the building which was convenient -- especially since the neighborhood is not particularly good for small restaurants etc. Room service breakfast was prompt and good. They even provided the hot milk I requested (to make my own latte with the room coffee) fair value if the location is convenient for you.,

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great for Kids!”
Reviews.Author: carlaroseberry
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel over Easter Weekend. We enjoyed our stay in Chicago, visiting a few museums. The kids under 12 eat free in the hotel at every meal. The only drawback, is that the prices for adult food are high, and when they take the price of the child's food off, they leave on the full price of the tax before the discount, and added the tip themselves, with the full price. This aside, the food was still great, and the pool was a lot of fun for the kids. We had two rooms to accomodate all of us (we have 5 kids) and the views of the city were really beautiful. The staff was excellent, friendly and helpful. The beds were fluffy and comfortable, and we had a large television with all the cable channels to watch in the evenings after a day of sightseeing. I would definitely tell my friends to stay at the Holiday Inn Chicago Mart!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: omahatraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Mart Plaza over President's Day weekend, booking the rooms on Priceline at $75 per night. We were in Chicago for a weekend to enjoy the city, so our time in the hotel was limited. The location is convenient for driving in and the parking lot is more than adequate. If you're on a business trip to the Loop, this would certainly be a good choice. For a weekend/family getaway, you may want to look for something like the Hyatt Regency just to be closer to Michigan Ave and the main tourist sites. The layout of the hotel, entering through the building lobby and then proceeding to the hotel lobby on the 15th floor, is somewhat inconvenient, but certainly not a problem. Unload your bags before you park. Parking is $27 a day with unlimited use, so if you'll be traveling by car during your stay, it's a good value. Otherwise, the El Brown line stop at Merchandise Mart is located a block east (through the Mart building). Michigan Ave is a six block walk to the east, certainly doable, even in winter. Room had a great view looking over the Chicago River and the Mart. Room was very good size, bed was comfortable and the bathroom was fine - all in all, this is a very nice Holiday Inn. It's certainly a great value on Priceline, and would be a good value in general.

Reviews.Title: “Okay; free self-parking is a bonus”
Reviews.Author: Dianefromderby
Reviews.Content: Family of four stayed here on a cold, snowy Presidents Day weekend. Location is ideal; there is an enclosed walkway to access the above-ground mass transit, the "L." Our room was comfortable, spacious, plenty of towels, TV worked fine. Beds were acceptably comfortable. The view was amazing - we were on the 21st floor. The hotel itself begins with its lobby on the 15th floor - so every room has some kind of view of the lights and the city. Our bathroom had a large crack in the sink. Our children were told by other kids in swimsuits that the indoor pool was cold. Room service prices were outrageous (and they like to heap on taxes and extra fees and gratuities to the point of being beyond belief!) and there is no nearby quick food on a Friday night, we discovered. We recommend breakfast or other fast meal at the Billy Goats Grill located in the adjacent "Shops at the Mart." Our room rate was $135 (closer to $180 with taxes) for two double beds but it did include free self-parking. The entrance is very difficult to find; it is at the side of the building and poorly marked. From our parking space (outdoors), it was quite a hike up many, many icy stairs to the Sun-Times lobby, from where guests take a direct elevator to the lobby on Floor 15.
